He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through his brother, who also works with the institution. This is his 5th loan, for the amount of 25,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy products (soft drinks, beer, cookies, crackers, popcorn and other items) in order to increase his stock of merchandise. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and build a security wall around it.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer, soft drinks, cookies and popcorn

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 48 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ramiriza Group

texts.fr:
Marie Claire N. est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite la Commune de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de charbon au quartier Kanyosha à Bujumbura. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 2 ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 7e année. Son époux, N., est un chauffeur. Elle arrive au 6e cycle avec le crédit de Turame. 

Elle est mère de 3 garçons âgés respectivement de 6 ans, 3 ans et 1 année  3mois. L’aîné est à l’école. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour changer le type de business en achetant des habits pour les revendre au marche Central de Bujumbura. Elle espère ainsi que cela lui permettra d’acquérir une plus grande capacité de générer du bénéfice pour parvenir à construire sa propre maison. Elle a l’espoir que ses enfants finiront les études avec succès et  être capables de lui venir en aide dans le futur a cote de mener une vie meilleure. Elle va continuer à demander le crédit Turame car il est le plus préfère aux autres institutions financières car les conditions d’accès et de remboursement sont plus faciles. Elle conseille à tous ceux qui veulent pratiquer le commerce que la persévérance est la clé du succès dans ce métier 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Ramiriza » qui veut dire « Continuer ».
texts.en:
Marie Claire N. is a 29-year-old merchant living in Kanyosha, a borough which is part of the Bujumbura mayorship. She has been selling coal in Kanyosha for the past two years, before which she was a cash crop farmer. She went to school until the 7th grade. Her husband N. is a driver. She is now in her sixth loan cycle with Turame. She is the mother of three boys who are 6 years, 3 years, and 1 year and 3 months old. The eldest attends school. She is requesting the Kiva loan to change her business activity and buy clothing for resale at the central market in Bujumbura. She hopes that this will increase her ability to generate revenue so that she can eventually build her own home. She hopes that her children will successfully complete their schooling and become able in the future to help her lead a better life. She will continue to request loans from Turame because their terms for loans and repayments are easier to handle than with other financial institutions. She advises those who wish to practice a commercial activity that perseverance is the key to success in this profession. She is a member of the “Ramizira” community group, which means “Continue”.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: changer le type de business en achetant des habits pour les revendre au marche Central de Bujumbura

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. R., 35, sells various kinds of vegetables in a local market to earn a living. She buys the vegetables in bulk from farmers or wholesale suppliers and sells them retail to people who come to buy something for their cooking. She is able to generate $4 a day to cover the family expenses.

R. is married to Sochea, age 38, who shares the responsibility for his family by working as a construction worker. They are good parents to their four children who are young and attending the public school.

R. is concerned that her business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient capital. She wishes to obtain more money by requesting a loan to use towards increasing her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. She will use any remaining money from the loan to mend her old house.

loans.use: To increase her business capital and to mend her old house

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: In Chamkar Tieng village in Takeo province has a person, Mrs. Vann B. was born in 1966. She is a Khmer noodle seller in local village where she can earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sat Touch, is a construction worker and he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Now she has a problem because her husband’s field is time to plow, but she did not have two oxen to plow. So to improve production, Mrs. Vann B. is applying for a loan to buy an ox to enough two oxen for plow. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers, while the other two are helping the parents’ businesses, and the youngest one is studying in local public school. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an ox to enough two oxen for plow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies that she’ll use to seal the walls of her house; and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Shirley Antuanet

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Las Mónicas, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace seis meses, ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo que recibió como parte adelantada de una herencia de su madre, en este terreno tiene instalado limón, esta fruta la cosecha semanalmente y las vende a las diversas plantas procesadoras que se encuentran instaladas en la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Shirley desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, de esa manera ella espera obtener una mejor producción y así obtener mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniento solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Shirley es una mujer tranquila y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder adquirir mas terrenos de cultivo. En la zona donde vive ella es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Shirley, 18, is single and lives with her parents in Las Mónicas, a rural area of the agricultural Tambogrande district which is an area where fruit for export is produced and is located in Piura province, Piura region, more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. Shirley has been farming for the last 6 months. She has a field that she got as a pre-inheritance from her mother. She has planted lemons which are harvested weekly for sale to various processing plants in the area. The income she earns is used to pay for personal expenses and to help her parents to support the family. Shirley would like to acquire fertilizers to provide her crop with care and maintenance so that production will be improved thus obtaining higher income. To reach this objective she has deemed it convenient to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time in the amount of 700 new soles. Shirley is a levelheaded, responsible woman whose greatest wish it to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to be able to acquire more land to farm. She is quite well-known and esteemed where she lives and her neighbors consider her to be an honest and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for lemon crop maintenance and care.

loans.name: Fedelina's Group

texts.en:
Fedelina B. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Fedelina is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fedelina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fedelina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Fedelina is just starting this business.

In 2010, Fedelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fedelina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fedelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh T. N., 52, is the mother of two high school students. She is a rice and vegetable farmer.  Anh also raises and sells pigs to support her family.

She has received loans since 2004 to expand her business.  Currently, Anh wants a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy 200 hens and hen food.

loans.use: Buy 200 hens and hen food.

loans.name: Dorfina Filipe

texts.pt:
Dorfina Filipe C. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos. Fez somente 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seus irmãos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a fim de continuar com seus estudos a residir com a sua tia. Trabalha como operaria agrícola numa empresa de produção agrícola ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salario de 1.690.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, cimento, barrotes, pedra, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir sua casa.
texts.en: Dorfina Filipe C. was born in Massinga, province of Inhambane, in Southern Mozambique. The mother of two, she left Inhambane to go live in Maputo with an aunt, in order to continue her studies. Her schooling was interrupted when she was in 7th Grade, due to financial constraints. She lives in a house she owns with her children and brothers, whom she supports. For the past four years she has been working at an agricultural factory, currently earning a monthly salary of 1.690.00mt, which allows her to take care of household expenses as well as save some money in the bank. Dorfina has never requested loans from other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are clients of the institution. This is her third loan and she plans to use the money to buy construction material (cement, iron, stones, beams, sand, zinc plates, etc) to continue the construction work on her house. She's confident in her ability to pay back the loan and plans to apply for more loans in the future, to finish the house.

loans.use: to buy construction material (doors, cement, beams, stone, sand, zinc plates, etc)

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El  Sr. Icavalceta es  originario del municipio de El SAUCE comarca el pilón tiempo en que ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente con tres  crédito consecutivo para compra de ternero.
En cuanto a este  financiamiento será utilizado para mejora de su finca  como  asegurar más su finca con el propósito de evitar que se le salgan sus animales y se les pierdan. 
Esto le permitirá al cliente y su familia  tener  mejores condicione de su finca y le rinda su pasto para sus hato ganadero.
texts.en:
Mr. Icavalceta is originally from the El Pilón hamlet of the town of El Sauce, where he has proven to be an excellent client, with three previous loans that he used to buy land.

He will use the money from this loan to make improvements so that his animals will not escape and get lost.  This will allow him and his family to have better conditions on the land and provide grass for his livestock to graze in.

loans.use: Build a fence

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Para la señora María este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le encantan las reuniones ya que además de aprender con las charlas educativas también se divierte. Tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y los otros tienen 17 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El esposo trabaja de conserje en una casa deportiva de la ciudad.

Tiene un negocio de preparación y venta de corviches, empanadas y helados de varios sabores, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende todas las tardes las empanadas y los corviches ya que los helados los vende todo el día, trabaja en las mañanas en la producción de sus productos y en las tarde los vende. Nos cuenta que lleva 5 años en esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos como maní, plátano y especias para la preparación de los alimentos. Además de una mesa y cuatro sillas para darle mas comodidad a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un restaurante o un bar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. María is participating in her fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the meetings as well as the things she has learned from the educational seminars. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are grown while the other two are 17 and 12 years of age and attending high school. Her husband works as a janitor at a sports facility in the city.

María has a business preparing and selling seafood cocktails, turnovers, and ice cream of different flavors. She has a small shop in her home where every afternoon she sells turnovers, seafood cocktails, and ice cream every day. María spends her mornings preparing the food that she will sell in the afternoon. She says she has been in business for five years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies such as peanuts, bananas, and spices used in preparing her food. In addition, she will purchase a table and four chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable. Her dream is to open a restaurant or bar.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts, bananas, spices, a table, and four chairs

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband manufactures wooden furniture, earning an income of about USD 3.33 per day. S. has to spend USD 56 on food, USD 12 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase hairdressing equipment to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: buy hairdressing equipment to start a business

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana del Carmen Pavón de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien vende calzado hace siete años la cual inicio con unos ahorros y ha continuado por medio de los préstamos. Ella con el crédito comprará calzado ya que en esta época por las fiestas navideña, los quince años, bodas, bautizos, promociones la población compra más. 
Pavón junto con su compañero de vida cría a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 12. 6 y 3 años por los cuales trabajan arduamente.
texts.en:
Johana del Carmen Pavón, 31, is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who has sold footwear for the last 7 years.  She started the business with some savings and has continued it using loans.

She will use the loan to buy footwear because during this Christmas, fifteen-year birthday parties, weddings, baptisms and school graduations season people buy more.

Pavón and her spouse are raising four children who are 13, 12, 6 and 3 years of age and for whom they work arduously.

loans.use: For footwear.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino A. necesita comprar celulares de gama baja ya que tiene mayor solicitud y quiere responder oportunamente a su exclusiva clientela, para no dejarla esperando mientras logra las ventas de contado y recupera su cartera.  Él con sus 26 años de experiencia,  sabe que si tiene un capital en efectivo para comprar permanentemente,  su dinero rota rápidamente y sus utilidades se incrementan. Eso es justamente lo que quiere hacer  con su credikiva: manejar un nuevo capital para comprar celulares de gama baja al por mayor y actualizar los accesorios, porque en navidades sus ventas se incrementan y necesita estar preparado. Este es  su financiamiento número 26 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que lo ha apoyado durante 14 años , desde cuando inició su  primer negocio que fue la venta de gafas y monturas para lentes,  en un sector muy comercial  donde ubicó  su  primer punto de ventas; él es un hombre satisfecho porque con el fruto de su trabajo en el negocio, pudo ahorrar para comprar su vivienda y ampliarlo y en estos últimos años con los cambios tecnológicos, ha agregado celulares, y adecuados accesorios hasta convertirlo en un sitio muy conocido llamado el "Primer Elemental", ubicado en un nuevo local, donde interactúa con la competencia y todos están en pequeños espacios, que cada uno ha logrado como producto de sus esfuerzos. Paulino es un hombre casado y ejemplar, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos en las edades de 28 a 34 años y es muy participativo en todos los eventos estructurados por la Fundación cuyo objetivo es su crecimiento empresarial. Con sus créditos anteriores ha logrado adquirir su nuevo local, ampliar su negocio, tener un inventario mayor y moderno que mostrar, adquirir vitrinas y enseres, lo que  hace que cada día su microempresa luzca mas armoniosa y capte la atención de nuevos clientes y conserve los actuales.
texts.en:
Paulino A. needs to buy low-range cellular phones, since he has increased requests for them and wants to respond in a timely way to his exclusive customers, so that he doesn't leave them waiting while he sells his current stock and recovers his investment. With his 26 years of experience, he knows that if he has permanent capital in cash for making purchases, his money revolves rapidly and his profits grow. This is exactly what he wants to do with his Kiva loan: manage new capital to buy low-range cellular phones wholesale and update the accessories, because at Christmas his sales increase and he needs to be prepared. 

This is his 26th loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that has supported him for 14 years, since he began his first business, which was the sale of eyeglasses and frames. His first sales location was in a very commercial sector. He is a very satisfied man, since with the fruit of his business labors, he was able to save to buy his home and enlarge it. In recent years, with all the technological changes, he has added cellular phones and suitable accessories, and he has converted his shop into a very well known place called "Primer Elemental. It is in a new location, where he interacts with the competition and all the merchants are in small spaces, which each one has achieved through his efforts.

Paulino is a married and exemplary man. He is 62 years old and has 4 children with ages between 28 and 34, and he is very involved in all the foundation's structured events whose objective is his growth as an entrepreneur. With his past loans, he has been able to acquire his new location, increase his business, have a greater and more modern inventory to show, and acquire showcases and equipment, which every day give his business a more pleasing appearance, capture the attention of new customers, and keep the present ones.

loans.use: Buy low-range cellular phones wholesale and update accessories.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 21 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, trabaja en un carwash y servillantas, tiene 6 años de trabajar en este lugar.
El necesita un préstamo para ampliar su vivienda, específicamente un cuarto ya que en el que esta es muy pequeño, la obtención de este préstamo será de mucha ayuda ya que estará contribuyendo a su vivienda y aprovechara para mejorar otras partes donde las paredes no están adecuadas.
Su objetivo es tener una mejor vivienda junto a sus familiares, que todos se sientan cómodos y tranquilos,  además de querer formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 21 years old and lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department.  He lives with his mother and siblings.  Manuel works in a carwash and tire shop.  He has been working there for 6 years.

Manuel needs this loan to extend his home.  He specifically wants to extend one of the rooms which is very small.  This loan will help him a lot as it will help him to improve his home and he will take advantage to also improve other parts where the walls aren't very good.  His goal is to have a better home for his family and for them all to be comfortable and relaxed.  He would also like to start his own family.

loans.use: To buy building materials to improve his home

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “MANANTIAL” es un grupo de 7 mujeres y un varón que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  es parte del centro focal de Santiago II, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.
Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos:   venta de comida, venta de cortinas, venta de juguetes, chofer, peluquería, venta de frutas.
Para su organización, la B. C. Manantial cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Marina, una tesorera, la señora  Guadalupe y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Karem.
 
La Presidenta, la señora  Marina está casada, tiene un hijo.    El negocio de la señora  Marina se encuentra en su propio domicilio y consiste en la venta de comida.   La pensión fue herencia de su mamá.  El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.2000.- y será destinado para la ampliación del negocio.

La señora presidenta nunca había sido socia de Pro Mujer, esta es su primera experiencia,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “el crédito”.
texts.en:
The "MANANTIAL" communal bank is a group of seven women and one man who have decided to unite in order to request a loan and receive training and healthcare.  They are  beginning their first year at the Santiago II focal center.

Each one of the members has their own business, be it service, production or trade.  These include: food sales, curtain sales, toy sales, driver services, hair salon, and fruit sales.

The Manantial communal bank has a board of directors with a president, Mrs. Marina, a treasurer, Mrs. Guadalupe and a secretary, Mrs. Karem.

The president, Mrs. Marina is married and has a son.  Her business is operated out of her home and involves food sales. She inherited her pension from her mother.  The amount of the loan is Bs. 2000 which will be used to expand business.
 
The president had never been a member of Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) so this is her first experience.  She was drawn to the institution because of the loan services.

loans.use: To extend pension terms

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace R. is from the city of Lam-an Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a mont.

In 2011, Mary Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Mary Grace's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La Sra. Ofelia T. Q. es una persona muy seria y responsable, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos que dependen  de ella, su único ingreso es su tienda de abarrotes, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y desea ampliar su  tienda futuro para  así  poner ofrecer mayor  mercancía  a sus clientes , su esposo el Sr. Raúl Arturo le ayuda a la señora en los tiempos libres que el tenga ya que el es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta el cual  quiere ver a su familia llena y completa de felicidad y alegría ofreciéndoles  un mejor  hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia T. Q. is a very serious and responsible individual. She is married and has two children who are dependent on her. Her only source of income is her grocery store. Ofelia is an enterprising person and wants to expand her store in the future so that she can offer more merchandise to her customers.

Her husband, Sr. Raúl Arturo, helps her whenever he has free time. Ofelia is hardworking and honest. By providing a better home, she hopes to see her family full of happiness and joy.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun Y. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sambath Sin, live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have a young daughter. 

Bunthoeun is a mason, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He asked for a Kiva loan to build his house. He now hopes to fill the land and pour the concrete foundation. That’s why he has applied for a second loan of $ 1,200.

loans.use: To fill the land and pour foundation for home

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim T. N. is 26  years old with two children who are at  high school. She is  a very hard working farmer. Currently, she is growing rice, beans and corn in a paddy of 4,200 square meters. Her agricultural  products are used to support her family's food demand and a part of them is sold  to earn daily income. 

Since joining the SEDA credit program in 2007, she has used her loans very effectively and has always been a good re-payer. 

To buy seed and fertilizer for her next crop, she wants to have a loan of 4,142,000,000 VND.

loans.use: to buy  seed and fertilizer for her next crop

loans.name: Kallayan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kallayan H. (pictured with her young daughter) is 29 years old and her husband, Mrs. Nueam Dy, is 33 years old. They have been married for almost two years. They have a young daughter. The family lives approximately 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
Kallayan stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He installs cell phone applications and MP3 and MP4 players as well as selling SIM cards and phone cards. People purchase a certain amount of minutes for their cell phone, and when they use up their minutes, they return to the store for another phone card.
Kallayan is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase additional SIM and phone cards for her husband to resell.

loans.use: to purchase additional SIM and phone cards for her husband to resell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 32 years old, married, and has four children. They live in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.She and the husband complement each other in taking care of the home. Their dream is to buy land and build a house. Christine has a clothing shop where her challenge comes from price fluctuation. Christine is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.en:
Doña Maria Petrona is the President of the Nueva Vida Group, which in English translates to the ¨New Life Group¨. Maria is 58 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her husband works in agriculture and helps support the family. 

Maria would like to use her portion of the group´s loan to purchase more pigs and hens for her animal raising business. She has 12 years experience raising animals and enjoys the work very much. She purchased her first pens and animals with family savings and started her business with a desire to work for herself. She hopes to continue to grow her business and run a much larger farm someday in the future.

Other group members of the Nueva Vida Group are involved in making sweaters and pants, clothing sales, general store management, and animal raising and sales.

loans.use: purchase more pigs and hens for her farm

loans.name: Annabelle Mariano's Group

texts.en: Annabelle is the leader of a seven-member group loan. Annabelle is married and 44 years old. She has a furniture making business where she sells tables, chairs, and cabinets in their village. She has operated this business for almost 15 years. Annabelle is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase burnishes (polishes) to beautify the products. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month in this business. She desires to have a successful furniture making business someday.

loans.use: To buy burnishes for furniture making

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Esther operates a clothes selling business.  She sells from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Esther faces a major challenge in competition from other clothes sellers in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Esther she wants to purchase 2 bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy 2 bundles of clothes to resell

loans.name: Susan Yatta's Group

texts.en:
Meet teachers of The SLC (Sierra Leone Church) Primary School, situated in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. SLC Primary School was built in 1909 by the Anglican Mission. SLC primary school is staffed with 42 teachers and has an enrollment of 1,025 pupils.  This is the first loan that teachers of SLC primary school are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these teachers’ standard of living will improve. 

Susan is the leader of this group of teachers. She is age thirty-one. Susan was born in N’Jalah, a village near Bo city. She is married and has two children – one in primary school and one in secondary school. Susan has been a teacher for five years now. Susan will use her share of this loan for developmental purposes; she will use it to pay school fees for her children. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of Sylvester, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yao Antoine

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 31ans. Yao  est revendeur de friperie (habits importés de l’occident) depuis 1998. Il achète au marché d’ASSIYEYE et revend au même lieu. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et assurer sa future vie maritale.
texts.en: A 31-year-old young man, Yao has been a retailer of second-hand clothing (imported from the West) since 1998. He makes his purchases at the ASSIYEYE market and re-sells at the same location. He is requesting this loan to bolster his business and to ensure a life of marriage in the future.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 40 años, vive en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Comenzar junto a su esposo, el trabajo arduo de la artesanía, fue fácil y divertido. Ahora que él se encuentra en Estados Unidos, trabajando como ganadero, se siente sola, pero eso no la desanima pues desde muy joven Maribel incursionó en el negocio de tejidos artesanales, trabajando para otras personas. Ahora ella se ha comprado sus propias maquinas de tejer y trabaja a pedido. Sus tejidos son de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual cada vez tiene más demanda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que ser creativa y muy disciplinada para cumplir con sus pedidos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin descanso para alcanzar su meta. Con tiempo, espera comprar más maquinas para poder incrementar su producción. Ya que necesita dinero para terminar de educar a sus hijos que se encuentran en la ciudad de Huancayo estudiando una carrera universitaria. Por lo que dentro de unos meses comprará su casa propia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos para poder impulsar su negocio. Asimismo agradece el apoyo de su asociación por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Maribel de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el pago para la compra de su propia casa y si el dinero le alcanza comprará varios hilos para tejer.
texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and lives in San Pedro de Cajas.  She is noted for being a very unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her parents’ house with her three beloved children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

She started the hard work of crafts making with her husband; it was easy and fun.  Now that he’s in the United States working raising cattle, she feels lonely but that doesn’t discourage her because from a very early age Maribel went into the business of weaving artisanal textiles working for others. Now that she’s bought her own knitting machines, she works on order.  Her textiles are of very good quality so demand grows every day.  

What she likes about her work is that she has to be creative and very disciplined to fill her orders.  She’s been in this occupation for ten years and considers the most difficult part having to work every day without rest in order to meet her goal.  In time, she hopes to buy more machines to increase production because she needs money to finish educating her children, who are in the city of Huancayo, going to the university.  In a few months she will buy her own house.

She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women to the Future) communal bank and this is the 9th loan with MFP where she hopes to have collaboration from all of you in order to propel her business ahead.  She also is grateful for the support from her communal bank so she commits to pay her installments promptly.

If Maribel were to obtain your support, she will invest the requested money to pay off her house and, if money is left over, she’ll buy yarn to weave.

loans.use: to pay off her house and also to buy knitting yarn.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 42 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. With 2 children in school, she works very hard to provide for her family.

Marjorie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, snack food, soap, etc.  She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as sardines, grocery items, etc. in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Marjorie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anais

texts.es: Anaís  de 22 años convive con Leoberto de 24 años, con quien tienen un hijo. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Anaís  viene laborando en este negocio desde muy joven. Siempre trataba de ayudar a sus padres en poner las semillas, y así le quedó la idea de tener su propio terreno de cultivo. Luego tras heredar el terreno de sus padres, se dedico a cultivar cacao y café porque ella cree que son productos que tienen mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional. Ella se levanta muy temprano, para ir a su parcela y darle el cuidado respectivo. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 8:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, por lo general siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus peones en temporada de cosecha. El cacao y café los vende en los centros de acopio y en el mercado de su comunidad, por el cual su margen de rentabilidad esta en crecimiento. En el futuro aspira tener su tienda de abarrotes, con la necesidad de poder diversificar su cartera de clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Anaís es la señora que brinda la estabilidad a su banco comunal por tener buenas visiones. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita, realizará la poda de su parcela de cacao, por ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Anaís is 22 and she lives with Leoberto who is 24 years old. They have a child together. They live in their own house in the Pichari distrcit. Anaís has been working in agriculture since she was very young. She used to always help her parents plant their seeds and that's how she got the idea to have her own farmland. After she inherited a piece of land from her parents, she began growing cocoa and coffee because she believes there is a high demand for these products on the national and international level. 

She gets up very early to go to her land and give it the care it needs. Her work hours are form 8:00am until 6:00pm. She generally hires laborers to help out during harvest time. She sells the cocoa and coffee in the center of Acopio and at the market in her community, which is why her profit margin is growing. In the future she would like to have her own grocery store, because she would like to diversify her client base. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she promises to pay it back on time. Anaís brings a lot of stability to her community bank by having really good ideas. With the loan she is requesting, she will hire farmhands to help with the pruning of her cocoa fields.

loans.use: to hire farmhands.

loans.name: Jarkynai's Group

texts.en:
Jarkynai, 19, is the leader of this group. She a young and ambitious entrepreneur who resides in the coal mining town of Tashkomur.  She is a mother of a young toddler, and to make a living she breeds, raises, and sells cattle.  When she gave birth to her daughter, she was given her first animal to raise, which her husband helps to take care of. Since then, two years have passed, and now she owns several heads of livestock and earns a monthly income of 7,000 soms. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more livestock. Jarkynai has a medical education and her dream is to earn enough money to open her own pharmacy. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 38, lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is divorced and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Esther has a restaurant business, which she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food to sell in her restaurant. With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Esther hopes to expand her business. She is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Sali (Le monsieur en  t-shirt bleu) est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est célibataire. Il a 01 enfant.
 Sali travaille comme revendeur de produits congelés depuis 2003. Il vend à ses clients  dans un marché de la place Il achète les produits à LOME. 
Sali a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés.
texts.en:
Sali (wearing a blue t-shirt in the photograph) is 31 years old, single, and has one child. Since 2003, he's been working as a reseller of frozen goods. He sells to his customers in one of the place's market, and gets his supplies in Lomé.

Sali is seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy frozen products.

loans.use: to buy frozen products

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighboring community members. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. Kuvuna dreams of establishing more retail shops in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 26-year-old Lebanese man living with one parent and two siblings and engaged to be married. He has owned a Hubble-bubble (water pipe) shop since 2005. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to improve his shop and purchase additional products needed. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits at least by 5%. In the future, he plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to improve his shop and purchase additional products needed.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 15000 (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

Eva has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Son 02 años que Bania se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas y hamburguesas sus consumidores son los colegas D. su esposo que son en su mayoría choferes  y cobradores D. transporte público, en realidad fue su esposo quien la animo a poner ese negocio debido a que sus colegas son grandes consumidores D. esos alimentos,  antes ella vendía  otro tipo tipo D. productos fue con sus ahorros  que pudo comprarse un carrito sanguchero  indispensable para este tipo D. negocio,  no se pueD. quejar le va muy bien sus clientes algunas veces le piden comidas extras lo que le implica ganancias extras, esto le ha permitido tener algunas comodidades en su hogar para vivir cómodamente,  ahora está ahorrando para el futuro porque  quiere poner un negocio D. comidas  en su casa, con el préstamo que recibirá   comprara un balón D. gas  y gaseosas para su negocio, Bania es secretaria del grupo “ LAS HORMIGUITAS” nombre peculiar que escogieron porque son muy trabajadoras.

*Bania es la 6ta D. las paradas esta con chompa marrón.
texts.en:
Bania has been selling salchipapas (fried sausages and potatoes) and hamburgers for two years. Her customers are her husband's co-workers, who are mostly drivers and fare collectors on local buses. 

In fact, it was her husband who encouraged her to set up that business, due to the fact that his co-workers eat a lot of those foods. Before, she used to sell another type of product, and it was with her savings that she was able to buy a small food cart, indispensable for this type of business. 

She can't complain, as it's going very well. Sometimes her customers ask her for extra meals, which means extra earnings. This has allowed her to have a few home comforts. Now she is saving for the future, because she wants to set up a food business in her house. With the loan she receives, she will buy a tank of gas and soft drinks for her business. 

Bania is the secretary of the "Las Hormiguitas" (The Ants) group; an odd name they chose because they are very hard-working. 

*Note: In the photo, Bania is the sixth of the ones standing, and is wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use:
COMPRA DE UN BALON DE GAS Y GASEOSAS
To buy a tank of gas, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and four children who are still attending school. He has been working in the construction field for the past 10 years, specialized in floor covering.  In 2008, he decided to start working independently. Today, he’s applying for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. Youssef’s main goal is to allow his children to pursue their education properly until graduating.

loans.use: To pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with five children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the others are grownups. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Kache has operated a livestock-selling business (goats and cattle) for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase more goats and cattle for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 53 years old, married, and the father of one child. He operates an agrovet business (providing farm and animal products) and has been in it for the last three years with a monthly profit of approximately KES 20,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 60,000 from the company, which he plans to use to purchase a scale, fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and continue taking care of his family. In future, Paul hopes to grow his business and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy a scale, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Merle has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

Merle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David used his previous loan to buy crates of beer and local gin for resale. His main challenges have been price fluctuations, inflation, and high taxes levied on him. He started with capital of 500,000 shillings, but now it is worth 2,000,000 shillings. David needs this loan to buy local gin for resale this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy local gin for resale this Christmas season.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, llamada también San Bautista del Valle, tiene hermosos lugares para disfrutar de los paisajes de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad.

Doña María tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 22, 20, 17, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, dos de sus hijos estudian en el colegio, su hija trabaja y ayuda con los gastos del hogar y dos de sus hijos están estudiando en la escuela. Su esposo labora en la agricultura y es negociante de animales, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y labora en la agricultura siendo sus cosechas para su consumo y al igual que su esposo se dedica al negocio de ganado hace 10 años.
 
En el banco comunal es socia hace 15 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos. 

Su meta es tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in a community in the El Valle parish in Cuenca, also called San Bautista del Valle. It has beautiful places to enjoy the natural landscapes. Its people work in business, raising animals, and agriculture, and many work in the city every day.

María is 39 years old. She is married, and this union has produced 6 children aged 3, 5, 7 ,17, 20, and 22. Two of her children are secondary school students, her daughter works and helps with household expenses, and two of her children are primary school students. Her husband works in agriculture and sells animals. The house they live in belongs to them.

María takes care of her home and works in agriculture. Her family consumes what she harvests, and like her husband, she has sold livestock for 10 years.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 15 years, and she will use her new loan to buy pigs.

Her goal is to have a dressmaking shop.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is from Don Jose Aguirre, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 30 years old and is married with two children.

In 2012, Jerlyn applied for her membership with PAGLAUM MPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Jerlyn has applied for financial assistance of PHP 14,900.00 for additional capital for her business. Through this, she hopes to increase the income of her fish vending. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a very active 42 year-old woman, her wish has always been to be independent and economically self-sufficient; this is why she has seven years of experience with sales. She decided to start a business on grocery sales in her house and day by day, the number of clients and business volume have been increasing.

She requires a financial support for her capital, because her clients have requested for her to offer more products. This is why she is requesting a loan for $475 USD, so that she can purchase more varied merchandise, and she plans to pay within 5-10 months. Support Mercedes in reaching economic self-sufficiency; she will be very grateful to you.

**

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes es una mujer muy activa de 42 años cuyo deseo ha sido poder ser independiente y económicamente autosuficiente, es por eso que tiene siete años dedicándose a las ventas y decidió poner un negocio de venta de abarrotes en su casa, el cual día a día ha ganado más clientes y por lo tanto ha aumentado su movimiento.

Requiere de un apoyo financiero para capital de trabajo, ya que sus clientes le han solicitado que ofrezca más productos, es por eso que el crédito que solicita es por $ 475 USD para comprar mercancía variada, el cual piensa pagar en un plazo de 5-10 meses. Apoya Mercedes a alcanzar su autosuficiencia económica, que ella te lo agradecerá.

loans.use: Purchase varied merchandise

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married and has two children. She lives in the Kombo area in Dar es Salaam. Leah owns a small canteen near the Dar es Salaam Harbour. She sells cold drinks, breakfast and lunch mostly to harbour workers.

Leah has received entrepreneurship and business training from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO) in Dar es Salaam. This training has helped her a lot. She knows how to keep records of her business and utilize opportunities that come around.

In usual working hours her business is normally flocked with customers in need of services. Inadequate facilities hold her back. She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables, food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks. To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD750 as working capital. Leah's dream is one day to have a professional catering business.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and food saving dishes

loans.name: Zulfugar

texts.en: Zulfugar A. is a citizen of Beylagan city. He engages in selling men's shirts at the Beylagan city bazaar. He is married and he has two children. He established his business five years ago. In 2007 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for loan and borrowed $700. He used this loan to buy more shirts. He thinks that everybody who is poor and wants to establish his or her job must apply to Normicro Beylagan Branch for money. He is very glad too that he is continuing his relationship with Normicro.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa T., 29, raises broccoli, cauliflower, and a little bean called "aba" and sells them in the major market in the nearby city of Quetzaltenango. She has only one little plot of land to raise her vegetables, and it's rented and costs about US$27/month. With her little business in the market she can make perhaps US$10/day. Maria will use this loan for seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for her crop. She has four children, all of school age, and all in school. She's married, and her husband works in the fields for others. She didn't go to school, but she reads a little and can sign her own name on documents, instead of using the very common technique of signing with a thumb print.  Maria's village is nestled right against the side of the Santa Maria volcano, part of a complex of volcanoes that regularly rumbles the area and that completely destroyed the village in the early 20th century. It's a place of beautiful green hillsides and lush plots of corn and vegetables, all divided into little sections called cuerdas. The poorer women often rent just one cuerda and try to grow their own corn for the family and sell some vegetables from it. Those who have more sometimes own two or more cuerdas, and sometimes rent even more. It's hard work, and they always refer to their life as a "battle" or "struggle", but they continue with the battle to feed their families and keep the kids in school.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for vegetable crops

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Samir is a 30-year-old internally displaced person from the Aghdam region of Azerbaijan. He now lives in the town of Khachmaz, where he  works as a taxi driver using his own car. He drives both within the town and longer distances to places such as Baku. To continue to support himself and his family, he needs to get the engine of his car rebuilt, buy spare parts and pay for repairs. Because he does not have the funds to do this, he has come to Normicro Khachmaz for a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Alesi

texts.en: Alesi is 42 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling items needed by the people of her village from several tables she has set up alongside her house. In the past, she used a $300 loan to purchase inventory, and was very pleased at the return she earned and the ability it gave her to meet the needs of her family and educate her children.  Now she has come to us for a second loan, which she will use to build a small enclosure where she can sell her goods and in which she can also store them while she is away.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: Tolibjon B. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He is a permanent client of MicroInvest because he trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He has recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. He engages in commercial services and trade.  Tolibjon works in the confectionery business, baking and selling fancy cakes . He has a wide assortment but wants to improve the business by delivering new products . He has been in this business for 23 years. Tolibjon B. works in the Kistakuz bazaar where his shop is located. Now he requests a loan  for  business support and to expand his products.

loans.use: For business support and to expand his products.

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.ru:
Ulmas V. is 42 years old, she has a specialized secondary education, she is not married and has 2 children. Ulmas is selling perfumes and cosmetics at one of the markets in the city of Vahdat. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. She wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of her merchandise. This loan will give an opportunity for the residents to buy the necessary products like hair coloring products, makeup, facial creams and other essential women care products.

Ulmas plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вафоева Ульмас– 42 года, образование средне-специальное, незамужем, имеет 2-х детей. Ульмас имеет торговую точку на рынке в городе Вахдат. Она занимается продажей парфюмерии. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 12 лет. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Полученный кредит даст возможность населению приобретать необходимые им товары для покраски волос, тени, крема а также другие принадлежности необходимые женщине для ухода за собой.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr:
This is Mrs. T. second loan. Her business is at the large market in another village where she buys and resells smoked fish. This will allow her to help her husband with expenses for the children's education and the food.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame T. est a son 2e pret ; son activite consiste a au grand marche d' un autre village pour acheter des poissons fumes et les revendre ; cela lui d ' aider son mari a entretenir l' education et la nourriture de ses 3 enfants .

loans.use: She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials

loans.name: Ni Komang Maria Coa

texts.id:
Ni Komang Maria Coa and her husband use to live in Timor-Timur (East Timur) because her husband was in the military. Because of the conflict there, their family moved to the area of Banjar Pangkung Liplip in the village of Kaliakah in Western Bali, where her husband was born. Maria Coa and her husband have three children. To help keep her family going she opened a general store at their house using 5,000,000 Rupiah that her husband gave her. At her store she sells vegetables, various snacks, rolls, rice, soft drinks and kerosene. She travels to the market in the city to purchase the goods she sells in her store. She must spend as much as 200,000 Rupiah per day to purchase her goods and she makes at most 300,000 Rupiah per day in profits. She is usually left with about 50.0000 Rupiah (after putting money back into her business) which she uses to pay for her family's daily needs. Her husband's income is used to pay for her children's education. Recently the cost of the goods she buys at the market have gone up and the original funding she used is not enough to cover costs. Maria Coa would like to obtain a loan to help keep her business going and to grow it further.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Komang Maria Coa dan suami sebelumnya tinggal di Timor-Timur karena suaminya sebagai seorang tentara. Karena konflik yang terjadi disana, akhirnya mereka memutuskan untuk pulang kembali ke Bali tepatnya di tanah kelahiran suaminya Banjar Pangkung Liplip Desa kaliakah, Bali Barat. Maria Coa memiliki 3 orang anak. Untuk memenuhi semua kebutuhan rumah tangganya Maria Coa membuka usaha Warung di rumahnya dengan modal usaha dari suaminya sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- Adapun dagangan yang dijual diwarungnya seperti: sayur-sayuran, lauk-pauk, berbagai macam makanan ringan, roti, beras, berbagai macam minuman dan minyak tanah. Semua keperluan dagangannya dibeli di pasar pagi dikotanya. Setiap hari Maria Coa mengeluarkan modal untuk berbelanja sebesar Rp. 200.000.-Sedangkan pendapatan kotornya setiap hari mencapai Rp. 300.000.-. Dengan keuntungan setiap hari Rp. 50.000.- Dengan keuntungan inilah Maria Coa bisa membantu pengeluaran rumah tangganya. Sedangkan penghasilan suaminya dipakai untuk biaya pendidikan anak-anaknya. Maria Coa merasa bahwa saat ini harga barang semua naik dan modal yang diputar sudah tidak cukup. Untuk itulah Maria Coa bergabung didalam kelompok ini untuk mendapatkan bantuan Modal usaha dari Dinari agar usahanya bisa tetap berjalan dan menjadi berkembang.

loans.use: to increase capitol for her business

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto R. is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He has his own ranch in the municipality of El Sauce in León. He has worked at this business for a long time and acquired his abilities in ranching and farming when he was very young.

He is a married father with responsibilities for maintaining his four school-age children. He is known as being very responsible and hard-working, since every day very early in the morning he starts his job taking care of his fields while at the same time raising cattle in his own pen located at his house.

Ceprodel has been the backbone of his business because of having granted loans which have allowed him to improve his standard of living through the acquisition of cattle and vegetables for planting. Today, once again, he trusts that his credit will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of cattle and vegetables to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Gilberto R. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propia finca en el municipio El Sauce de León. Se dedica al negocio desde hace mucho tiempo habiendo adquirido habilidades con los animales y el cultivo desde muy jovencito en su localidad de habitación.

Es padre acompañado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus cuatro hijos en edad escolar. Se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajadora puesto que todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su trabajo de agricultura en la siembra y cuido de la cosecha y a la vez en la crianza de ganado en un corral propio en su casa de habitación.

Ceprodel ha sido una columna fuerte en su negocio debido a que le ha otorgado créditos que le han permitido mejorar su condición de vida ya que ha adquirido el ganado y a la vez ha adquirido las hortalizas para la siembra. Hoy en día una vez mas confía en que su crédito será aprobado y podrá mejorar en su negocio con la compra del ganado y las hortalizas para la siembra.

loans.use: Purchase and raise cattle.

loans.name: Chanphal Leang Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chanphal L., 58, is the group leader of five members in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a bicycle repairer and the father of four children, all of whom are enrolled in local school. His wife, Mrs. Sokuntheavy Kon, is a farmer and teacher.  They currently live in an old house whose roof leaks badly during the rainy season, so he is requesting a loan which, when added to his savings, will allow him to build a new house in the village.
 Previously, Mr. Chanphal L. obtained a loan to buy bicycle equipment for his village customers.

loans.use: To help build a new house.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort W. sells various provisions and firewood. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income from his job as a taxi driver is insufficient to meet the needs of and to support their family.

Even so, there is high demand for Comfort's goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to generate greater profits. Therefore, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive L., 59, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience in the elei printing business. She sells to the villagers and general public 5 days per week.

Nive has 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Nive’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Her current loan will be used to pay for the costs of operating the elei printing business, including labour costs. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her elei (a traditional way of printing textiles for shirts and dresses) business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 49-year-old married mother of 6 children. She lives in Migori, Kenya. She is the proprietor of a small kiosk that she initiated in 2004. She sells various essential fast-moving commodities such as bread, rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar, eggs, milk, salt, soap, etc. She requires US$600 to expand her business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida tiene 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos menores de edad. Tiene su pequeña bodega, que con mucho esfuerzo logró obtener hace 6 meses, desde entonces se dedica a ello a tiempo completo, gracias a que la instaló en su propio domicilio le ayuda a estar pendiente de su negocio y de su hogar, ya que se separó de su pareja y tiene que asumir doble rol de madre y padre para sus hijos.Sin duda, este negocio le ha ayudado mucho en su economía, pero lo que en verdad le agrada es poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus vecinos, ya que hay pocas tiendas en su comunidad, lo que es muy beneficioso para ella. Lo difícil es que tiene que trasladarse a las ciudades cada semana, para surtir su bodega.
Para Frida su motivo de progreso son sus tres pequeños hijos, quienes requieren de ella para salir adelante.
Desea incrementar sus productos y mejorar el ambiente de su bodega, para brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Frida is 33 years old and lives with her three young children. She owns a small shop that she obtained after much effort six months ago. Since then, she has dedicated all of her time to this business. Thanks to establishing it in her own home, she is able to attend to both her business and her home, since she separated from her husband and has to assume the double role of mother and father to her children. Without a doubt, this business has helped her a lot with her finances. However, what truly makes her happy is to satisfy the needs of her neighbors, since there are few shops in her community, so it is very beneficial. What is difficult is having to travel to the city every week in order to stock her shop.

For Frida, her motivation is her three small children, who need her to get ahead. She wishes to increase her products and improve the environment of her shop in order to provide better care to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise and improve her shop's environment.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en:
Lutfiya M. is 29 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children.

Lutfiya has dedicated herself to selling eggs in Dushanbe’s food market for the past 7 years. She has led a difficult life, particularly when she divorced and was unable to find work to replace her husband’s income and support herself. As a result, she decided to invest the small amount of savings that she was able to collect over many years in this business. She has expanded her business with the help of IMON. She has been acquiring greater amounts of eggs, which has helped increase her earnings, albeit very slowly.

Her plans are to invest more in her business through the purchase of additional products to sell. She requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for the term of 12 months. Lutfiya has worked with IMON for over a year and, despite the competition, she is starting to see better results from her endeavors. She proposes to continue with the loans which have so benefited her business.

loans.use: To purchase eggs to expand the business

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
Кучарова Махфират, 1984 года рождения. Зухра торгует на центральном рынке Гисара галошами и тапочками. Кроме этого дома в месте с братом занимаются откормом крупно-рогатого скота. В этом бизнесе у нее 4 года опыта. Она купила корову, чтоб откормить ее и продать по выгодной цене. Если корова будет продана за хорошую сумму, Махфират хочет купить два теленка и тоже откормить для продажи. Для покупки еще одного теленка ей нужны дополнительные средства.
Махфират хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб купить корову.
texts.en:
Mahfirat K. was born in 1984. She sells galoshes (overshoes) and slippers at the central market in Gissar. In addition, she raises livestock at home with her brother. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Mahfirat bought a cow in order to fatten it and to resell it at a profit. If she can sell the cow at a good price, Mahfirat would like to buy two calves and to fatten them for sale. In order to purchase one more calf she needs additional resources. Mahfirat would like to take out a loan for 4000 somoni ($1200) in order to purchase a cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en: Nuraddin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married with 3 children. Five years ago he started a business of transporting wheat and barley for sale. Now he needs a loan to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Rut

texts.fr:
Madame A. a vingt neuf (29) d’âge et réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé dans la ville de lomé, elle est très dynamique dans son activité qui n’est autre que le commerce de produits d’alimentation général. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, la demande ayant augmentée elle sollicite son premier crédit pour répondre convenablement à la demande augmentée par l’achat de bidons d’huile, de sacs de riz, de cartons de savons et de cartons de sucre
Elle est mariée et son mari est un agent commercial. Ils ont  trois (03)  enfants et elle compte avec les profits tirés de ce commerce aidé son mari dans les dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 29 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in the town of Lomé. She is very dynamic in her business which is the sale of groceries. She has never received a loan from WAGES, but with the demand getting higher, she is requesting her first loan to properly meet the increasing demand by purchasing oil drums, bags of rice, boxes of soaps, and boxes of sugar. She is married and her husband is a sales representative. They have three children, and with the benefit from her business she hopes to help her husband with the family's expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for store

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. Hean H. was born 1982 and she now lives in Phao Chu Kiet village, in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Chev Rumchan, is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it. Mrs. Hean H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 200 hundred ducks for her husband breeding farm. She is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy 200 hundred ducks for her husband breeding farm.

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.ru: Нарзулло отец двух дочерей ,возраст 40 лет, жена домохозяйка.Нарзулло работает в колхозе трактористом,его оплата труда не хватает на проживание,поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход с бизнеса скота.Каждые две недели он выезжает на рынок скота и ведёт куплю продажу скота.Он также имеет две коровы которые дают домашнее молоко.Весь их посёлок покупают молоко у его жены.Для увеличения своего бизнеса Нарзулло решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Narzullo is a 40-year old father of two children. His wife is a homemaker. Narzullo is a tractor driver at a collective farm but his income is not enough to support his family. Therefore Narzullo has a livestock business. Every fortnight he goes to the market where he buys and settles livestock. In addition, he owns two dairy cows, and the whole village buys milk from his family. Narzullo is applying for a loan in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia F. is the 50-year-old divorced mother of two sons and two daughters. One of her children has completed senior high school and yearns for more eduction, while the rest are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Afia lives with the children in a rented apartment in Dormaa Ahenkro, an agricultural community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, about a 45-minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

She works very hard to support the family and, most importantly, to settle the children’s school bills. One of her businesses is selling iced water by the roadside to passersby and other road users, procuring the water in sachets from distributers. On sunny days, patronage is strong. Afia also sells kerosene, a fuel used in lanterns and stoves, to the people in her neighborhood. She has been in business 15 years and is now requesting a loan to procure the sachet water and fuel in bulk. Her goal is to give all her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure sachet water and kerosene.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wenji
