texts.id: Dalam satu tahun ini,setelah mendapat pinjaman pertama dari Dinari, banyak keuntungan yang diterima oleh wayan Wenji. Hasil penyewaan kerbau yang dimilikinya sangat meningkat. Dalam satu tahun hasil penyewaan yang diterima sebesar Rp.3.000.000.- Dari hasil menyewakan kerbau, ia sudah bisa membeli satu ekor kerbau lagi. Ini juga adalah keuntungan dari usaha Wenji. Dalam kesehariannya wenji yang sudah setengah baya ini selalu pergi kesawah untuk mencari rumput untuk kerbaunya agar kerbau yang dipelihara tetap sehat dan kuat. Suaminya juga sering ikut membantu Wayan Wenji kalau lagi tidak sibuk. Mereka sangat senang dalam menjalani usaha ini. Karena mereka ingin untuk pinjaman yang kedua usaha mereka lebih berkembang. Wenji berharap bisa membeli sepasang kerbau lagi agar keuntungan dari penyewaan dan hasil dari anak kerbau bisa meringankan beban rumah tanggannya sehingga perekonomian mereka lebih berkembang.
texts.en:
In this year, after receiving the first loan from Dinari, Ni Wayan Wenji made much profit. Revenue from leasing the buffalo she owns continued to increase. In a year lease revenue received amounted to Rp.3.000.000.- From the buffalo lease revenue, she is able to purchase another buffalo. This is also profit from Wenji’s effort. Everyday, Wenji who already partially repaid this goes to the rice field to collect grass for the buffalo so that the buffalo being reared will be healthy and strong. Her husband also partakes to assist Wayan Wenji if he is not busy. They are delighted in performing this effort. As they are desirous of a second loan to develop their efforts further. Wenji hopes to purchase another pair of buffaloes so that profit from lease and revenue from the young buffalo will lighten the family’s burden so that their economic condition more stable.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy buffalo

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Elle est restauratrice à la gare routiére de kolda. Ses services offerts sont le petit-déjeuner et le repas de midi seulement. Juliette S. est mariée et mére de deux enfants. Pour assurer un bon service à ses clients composés en majorité de chauffeurs etd'apprentis- chauffeurs, elle a embauché une aide-ménagére qu'elle paye 20 00F CFA le mois.Elle voudrait agrandir sa gargotte qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins sociaux et ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Juliette does catering at the bus station in Kolda. She only offers breakfast and lunch. Juliette S. is married and the mother of two children. In order to ensure good service for her customers, composed mainly of drivers and apprentice drivers, she has hired a helper whom she pays 2000 F CFA per month. She would like to expand her little cafe which allows her to support herself and her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: catering breakfast and lunch

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah A. is a forty-four-year-old married man and the father of two children, a son and a daughter. He says his son has yet to start school while his daughter is in nursery school. His wife works to make some income to help him out financially. She is a food vendor.

Issah lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Issah is a butcher. He works in his own small abattoir shed in the market square. He buys live animals such as goats, sheep, cattle, etc, kills them and sells the meat. According to Issah, most of his customers are food vendors in his community. He buys the livestock from the farmers in his community. He has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Luz es conviviente tiene  46 años, cuatro hijos D. 28,26, 24, 20 años ellos estudian y trabajan.
Luz tiene diez años vendiendo  menú,  actualmente tiene 40 comensales les lleva todos los días venD. desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Sus hijas le ayudan y su esposo también.    
Luz necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. termos, taper,  arroz, aceite y fideos.  
DesD. que está en Finca aprendió a invertir y administrar  su negocio.
El sueño D. Luz es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Viñedos community bank. She is 46 and in a common law marriage. She has four children ages 28, 26, 24, and 20. They go to school and work. For ten years Luz has been selling fixed price meals. She currently takes meals to 40 customers every day. She sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Her daughter and her husband help her. Luz needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy a thermos, candle, rice, oil, and noodles. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to invest and to run her business. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a thermos, candle, rice, oil, and noodles

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ángela del carmen M., tiene la edad de 40 años habita en el barrio , San Juan , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos , todos menores de edad , actualmente estudian y le poyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace cinco años doña Ángela trabaja con las tierras que le heredo su papá , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos . Con el financiamiento obtenido va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el M..
texts.en:
Ángela del Carmen M. is 40 years old and she lives in the San Juan neighborhood along with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses. They have three children, all of whom are still minors. They study and also help her with the agricultural work. Her plan for her family’s future is to improve their living conditions. For the past five years, Ángela has been working the land she inherited from her father. Her biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. She began doing this work by her own initiative. With the financing obtained, she will buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve her crop so she can have a good harvest and sell at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve her crop

loans.name: Elizaphan

texts.en: Elizaphan S. is the 46-year-old owner of a hardware shop in Kigali, the Rwandan capital, where he works 12 hours per day. He is married and has three children aged six, eight, and twelve. He has been in the business for ten years and earns just 150,000 Rwandan francs (RWF) per month. His wife also contributes about 20,000 RWF per month to the family’s income by selling food crops. Now Elizaphan has requested his first loan of 500,000 RWF, which he hopes to use to expand his business and start some savings.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Joshqun

texts.en: Joshqun I. is a 27-year-old man who opened a small café where he sells beer and other drinks, such as fresh juices. He is married and lives with his parents. His dream is to build his own café where he can sell food, as well as drinks. He started his business in 2004 and, since that time, his small café become very popular among local people. Now Joshqun would like to expand his business and improve his working place so he can approach his dream.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Area Five borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 40-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children. Her children are aged 19, 14, and 10 years. She also cares for one other dependent. 
Maria started her own business selling food 10 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Maria’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 TSH in order to buy rice and beans. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Maria hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans

loans.name: Francisca Cristina

texts.es:
La sra. Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor D. la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad D. Puno, provincia D. Puno, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda,  y es madre D. 3 hijos (2 a su cargo), ella estudio educación primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en el Barrio Alto Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra D. abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella lo va invertir en su tienda D. abarrotes, para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, gaseosas; así mismo ella se dedica a la venta D. artesanías en miniatura y viaja a todos los santuarios D. la región para venderlos.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando  especialmente en su artesanía en miniaturas.

A ella le gusta las facilidades en los prestamos y les enseña a ser puntuales.
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), which is located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 60 years old, widowed, and the mother of 3 children (of whom 2 are dependents). She has a first graD. education and lives in the neighborhood of Alta Bellavista. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used as capital to purchase groceries. At the moment, she is requesting another loan in the amount of 1200 soles to invest into her grocery store. She will purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, and sodas. Sra. Cristina also sells miniature handicrafts and travels to all the shrines in the region to sell them. She hopes to continue working with her miniature handicraft business. Sra. Cristina likes the ability to access credit since it has taught her to be punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, and sodas

loans.name: Sabina Anyango

texts.en:
Sabina is a single lady who owns an open-air shop where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been running her business for the past 11 years, and makes a profit of approximately 5,500 KES a month. Sabina had previously received a loan from Sunlink, another MFI in Kenya. She was later introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a member.

Sabina's business is at the side of the road in the Buruburu area, enabling her to attract customers who are just passing by as well as neighbors. She wants to use her loan to buy more stock.  With the excess profits, she hopes to buy a stand to use as a temporary shop and, eventually, to get a more permanent location.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the Mtiwila borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 23, 19, 10 years old.

Neema has owned a clothing business selling used clothes for 20 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Neema first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan,Neema hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Adull Zohor Group

texts.en: A. Zohor is the group leader of Adull Zohor group. They are three members in this group. They are wants to take a loan for expanding business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan of 30000 Afghani. A. zohor wants to take a loan for the business of fruits selling cart. Esha wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring.Rohina wants to take a loan for her husband who his general store. So they are very thankful from Kiva lenders that can support all entrepreneurs

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato P., who lives in the village of Sitio Tuburan, Barangay Camba-og, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental, is 33 years old and single, but he has a fiancée whom he plans to marry when all the wedding arrangements have been made. Renato is the 5th child of twelve siblings and he is taking care of his mother. To support his parents and prepare for his future, Renato engaged in a pig-fattening business, and he has two productive sows today. All the piglets of the two sows were sold and the income he obtained was used to buy additional pig feed and even vitamins for the sows. It was also used to help support his family expenses, and most especially his mother. Renato found out that he needed additional capital to expand his business and to support the needs of his business. In 2004 he became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and was able to obtain a loan for his business needs. His business improved because of the loan and he was able to add more piglets to raise and sell. And, as the amount he could borrow increased because of his good credit record, he was able to improve his business facilities and was able to earn PHP 4,000 per month, which was enough to sustain his business, support himself and his mother, and set aside some amount for his future family. For his previous loan, Renato borrowed Php 14,000 which he used as additional working capital for his business. The said loan amount was repaid in weekly installments and was fully repaid on time and without any delays. That’s why he is planning for his 10th loan to borrow the same amount. It will be used to purchase additional livestock to raise and to sell and whatever income arises from it will be used to improve and expand his business even further. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has two children. She is 38 years old. She and her husband have been dairy-cow farmers for many years. They waited several years before they began having children because Elena was in poor health. After they were able to have their first child, they felt like their lives were complete. Elena and her husband then began constructing a small mill, where her husband, Carlos, produces cattle feed for their livestock and sells the remainder at the Huaña Cahua market.

After her children overcame illnesses, Elena enrolled them in a local school. After school each day, the children help Elena and Carlos by tending to the livestock. The older child also helps Elena's husband with the mill, making cattle feed for their livestock.

With this loan, Elena hopes to grow and expand her production of cattle feed so that they can build a reputation among other livestock farmers for their great product. This way, they can increase their sales and their earnings.

loans.use: Equipment for cattle feed production

loans.name: Mbéry

texts.fr: Mbéry N. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et a la charge de 10 enfants. Elle a une ancienneté de 7 ans et demi dans le Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH et y a reçu 15 prêts qu'elle rembourse chaque fois sans difficulté. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et bovine, vend des arachides, du sel et du mil. Elle soutien son mari dans les différentes de la maison.
texts.en:
Mbéry N. is a 42-year-old married woman with 10 children to support. She has 7½ years of seniority with Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH and has received there 15 loans, which she repays each time without a problem. She fattens sheep and cattle, and she sells peanuts, salt, and millet. She supports her husband in covering various household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her commercial work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional drinks for her bar business

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati, a 30-year-old businesswoman, is married with a child who is currently in school. Fati trades in clothes and scarves. She has been in business for the past 10 years. She buys her stock at wholesale prices and sells to her customers on a retail basis.

Fati wants to use the loan to include the sale of shoes to make extra income. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes and scarves

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 31-year-old university student and a single mother who lives with her two sons in La Suiza de Turrialba, a region in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. She has a business selling various products such as clothing, jewelry and cosmetics by going door-to-door in her community as well as at her university: Universidad de Florencio Castillos.

This will be Jessica’s 3rd loan with Fundacion Mujer. Her 2nd was for 200,000 colons and was paid back on time and in full. She is happy to be applying for a larger amount (500,000 colons) than she has in the past.

Jessica’s clients have been requesting a more diverse range of products such as hand creams and other items she currently does not offer. This loan will be used to satisfy those demands. Specifically, Jessica will use this loan to build up her inventory levels by purchasing larger quantities of products from her suppliers in San Jose. Jessica is confident that a larger volume in purchases will guarantee her a lower price and allow for higher profit margins.

Jessica says that her lack of working capital is her main limitation. Testaments to her acute business sense are her ability to triple her client base since she opened her business in 2007 and her success in implementing and enforcing a policy for her credit clients (people who buy clothes on credit) of no more than 60 days of credit.

Prior to enrollment in university and starting her own business, Jessica worked as a receptionist for two years. She says “I enjoyed my job, but I didn’t see myself there permanently.” She started her business in order to earn a supplemental income with an initial investment of 100,000 colons from her first loan with Fundacion Mujer. With her business, in a good month she can earn 400,000 colons, in a bad month only 200,000.

When she isn’t making sales or taking care of her children, Jessica attends classes in the afternoons and at night. The income she generates from sales is the only source of family income other than 80,000 colons per month she receives from the father of one of her sons.

Jessica’s dream job would be to become either a radiologist or a family lawyer. However, she has decided to study special education, to be able to teach children with mental and physical disabilities. She is in her first term of a four-year program and has decided to become a teacher because it will allow her spend more time with her children.

Jessica’s goals are to provide a better quality of living for her children. It is important to her that she raise her sons to have strong principles.

Jessica is an accomplished, determined and competent entrepreneur shown by her ability to build a house, attend university and take care of her two children. Since opening her business, her client base has grown significantly, a demonstration of her ability to effectively use past loans to strengthen her business. In order to balance her numerous demanding daily responsibilities, Jessica has become adept at time management. When her children are sleeping, Jessica studies or cleans the house; in the afternoons, she makes sales in the community; in the evenings, she attends night classes.

loans.use: To build up her inventory levels by purchasing larger quantities of products

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the village of Calaran in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Myrna is married and has 4 young children. To make a living, Myrna makes and sells bread in the community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Myrna's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha T. is 31 years old and lives in Ampil Lech village, Takeo province. She is a silk weaver and pig breeder from which she earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well and in order to expand her business, Mrs. Sokha T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk supplies and rest of the loan she would use to purchase three pigs and pig feed. With this loan she will increase her income and improving her family living standard. Mrs. Sokha T. is married and has three children, all between 1 to 6 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vin Kork is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to help meet the family's needs. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of silk and to purchase three pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda V. is a 43-year-old woman, married and blessed with five children. She and her husband worked together to raise their big family. They are currently living at Brgy. Bombong, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines. She is also a woman of good faith who defeats all challenges to reach her dreams. 

In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost two years, she has shown very good performance in her attendance in center meeting, weekly repayment and her business still exists; therefore, she is qualified to acquire larger loans. 

She runs a fish vending business and buys and sells rice and charcoal. She started her fish vending through her initiative of dealing with customers. She wants to continue her business; it gives them good income to support her five children's education. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income.

She dreams of growing her business. Her five children are her inspiration to pursue her fish vending business. She now feels very happy with the service of ASHI and KIVA. It gives them a big chance to pursue their family dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

About ASHI: 

Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To have additional working capital

loans.name: Miryam Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Miryam Q. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en el centro de la Ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad  que con  atractivos turísticos como son sus iglesias, su centro histórico que le hace encantadora a esta ciudad.

 Ella tiene 25 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 2 hijos su primer hijo se encuentra de 7 años y el  segundo 2 años, su esposo trabaja como carpintero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven cuidando un almacén.

Miryam se de dedica a la venta de cosméticos AVON lleva 2 años y YANBAL 4 años, ya cuentas con clientela que le hacen pedidos pero hay veces que no se vende nos comenta que su cuñada esta construyendo una casa en la cual le esta dando un pequeño terreno para que se ponga un taller de carpintería.

Se encuentra en la banco comunal hace 3 ciclos en la que los prestamos el han beneficiado para comprar sus productos y fue invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres unidas, con el nuevo crédito comprará  maquillajes, labiales, perfumes, etc. de la linea Avon y Yanbal, su meta es de llegar a construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miryam Q. is a member of the Reina de la Nube Communal Bank. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. The city of Cuenca has tourist attractions such as churches. Its historical center makes this an enchanting city. She is 25, married, and has two children. Her first child is seven, and her second child is two. Her husband works as a carpenter. They do not have their own house, so they live by taking care of a store. Miryam has been selling Avon cosmetics for two years and Yanbal cosmetics for four years. She has customers who make orders, but sometimes they are not sold. She tells us that her sister-in-law is building a house, and she is giving them a small piece of land to set up a carpentry shop. She has been in her communal bank for three cycles. The loans have helped her buy products. Her sister-in-law invited her to join this group of united women. She will use the new loan to buy make-up, lipstick, and perfumes, etc. from the Avon and Yanbel lines. Her goal is to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy make-up, lipstick, and perfumes from the Avon and Yanbel lines

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesús, se forma en el mes de diciembre, a mediados del año 2008. Son del barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso; actualmente están 23 señoras.

Son un grupo que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de mercaderías de primera mano, como ser ( aceite, leche, jabón, leche, papel higiénico, entre otros . Agradecen infinitamente a KIVA Y la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada.
Una de las integrantes es la señora trabaja en una despensa que posee en su casa (venta de productos de uso domésticos).En la despensa se ofrecen todo tipo de productos, ella atiende el negocio con la ayuda de su familia y tratan de manejarla de la mejor manera posible ya que es muy importante en cuanto a la ayuda que brinda con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para la despensa como; arroz, fideos, lácteos,panificados, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño Jesús” group was created in December, 2008. It is comprised of 23 women from the San Antonio neighborhood in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.

They are primarily dedicated to the sale of basic goods such as cooking oil, milk, soap, toilet tissue, among others. They are profoundly grateful to KIVA and the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity offered to them. One of the group members works in a store she operates from within her house (selling products for home use). She sells all types of products in her store and she, herself, runs the business with the help of her family. They try to run it in the most efficient manner possible as it helps them cover their housing expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more goods for her store, such as rice, pasta, dairy products, and baked goods, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baked goods, dairy products, canned goods, pasta, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. TOMASAI,  Nuestra socia tiene 58 años  casada y tiene 1 hijo, de 13 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, nuestra socia tiene terrenos de cultivos en los que produce papa, maíz, habas, cereales, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora desde muy temprano está tras de sus animalitos llevándolos a pastear y después a limpiar poco a poco su terreno ahora nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas, y guardará un poco para pagar el jornal (el diario de trabajo) de sus trabajadores en cuando hagan la siembra.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tomasa belongs to the community bank “Sacro”. She comes from the town of Chinchero in the community of Cruz Pata, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, located in the department of Cusco. Tomasa is 58 years old and has one 13 year old son. Tomasa alternates between her domestic and agricultural tasks to tend to her cultivated land which produces potato, corn and cereal. She is a very hardworking woman, getting up very early in the morning to take her animals out to pasture. Now that she has cleared her land she is applying for a loan to purchase fertiliser and seeds, and to keep some to pay her workers after they sow the seeds. Tomasa is very grateful for the valuable support which Kiva offers her and promises to make her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser, corn seeds, potatoes, cereal and pay workers

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur Gora D. est vieux qui a fait pendant toute sa vie de l'agriculture. Il est également répararteur de montre au niveau du marché de Thiès. avec l'arrivée de la saison des pluies, au mois de Juillet, Monsieur D. voudrait d'un crédit d'une petite somme comme il le dit pour sa culture. En fait, il veut acheter des graines d'arachide pour son champ. En fait devenu vieux , son petit fils se charge de lui cultiver son champ.
texts.en:
Mr. Gora D. is old and has spent all his life working in agriculture. He is also a watch repairer at the market in Thiès. With the arrival of the rainy season in July, Mr. D. would like a small loan for his agricultural activity. In fact, he would like to buy peanut grains for his field. Because he is old, it is his grandson who is taking responsibility for cultivating his field.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of peanut grains to sow

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda U. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Luzminda joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kamuyusu Group

texts.en:
Issa T. (pictured third from left) is the leader of this group. Born in Mayorloh, on the outskirts of Magburaka town, the 29-year-old father of five sells shoes, cloths, trousers, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc. He has been running this business for nine years now. With the help of this loan, Issa will be able to expand his business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity. This will lead to an increase in sales and profit and Issa will thus be in a better position to look after his children, two of whom are in primary school, one in secondary school and the other one still an infant. 

This group is named "Kamuyusu", a Temne phrase meaning “Be Patient With Us”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Magburaka, the headquarter town of the Tonkolili district in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 800,000 leones each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy shoes, cloths, trousers, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc.

loans.name: Rodolfa

texts.en:
Rodolfa C. is a 58-year-old, married woman who supports her family by operating a tailoring business. She lives in Proper, Brgy. Azagra, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental.

She has been a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon since 2001, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her tailoring business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 4,000 PHP.

Rodolfa is now seeking to borrow 20,000 PHP ($450) so that she can purchase additional fabric. Notably, this would be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan, which was in the amount of 18,000 PHP and which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rodolfa aspires to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fabric

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en: Khadija lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. Her husband runs a scrap shop in a nearby market but his earnings are not enough to fulfill the basic needs of his family, which is why Khadija started a clothes-selling business to help financially. Earlier, she sold clothes within her community but now she sells clothes in the markets. She is the mother of two daughters, both of them getting their education. Khadija has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy more scrap material and enhance his business. She is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her. Her husband will be able to increase his income and provides a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie D. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Rosalie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of firewood in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood supplies & provide working capital

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío San Martín, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Adicionalmente posee un terreno en el cual tiene instalado un cultivo de mango y limón, el limón es cosechado semanalmente y el mango es cosechado una vez por año, los productos que cosecha los vende a las plantas procesadoras de la zona. Con estos negocios apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Gladys desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Gladys es una persona tranquila y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Martín, a rural area of the agricultural district of Tambogrande, known as a fruit for export producing zone, located in Piura province, Piura region, over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She sells catalogue cosmetics and beauty products. She has a group of regular customers that buy her products frequently. The more orders they place the more points she gets from the firm that provides the products and therefore more profits. For this reason, she always does her best to acquire more and more customers every time. In addition she has a field where she grows mangoes and lemons. The lemons are harvested weekly and the mango is harvested once a year. She sells the products she harvests to local processing plants. These businesses help her husband support the family. Gladys would like to be able to count on stable capital to buy more products to have stock of cosmetics available so that her customers can buy the products they need quickly and not have to wait until the end of the month which is when she gets her orders. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 600 new sol loan to reach her goal. Gladys is a calm, very hard working person. Her greatest wish is to see her business grow and to be able to help support her family. Where she lives she is very well known and liked by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita A. is from the village of Punta Miray, Baliangao. She is 55 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lolita runs a grocery store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling household items such as canned goods, soap, sugar, etc., in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2001, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris P. is from the village of Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old and married. To make a living, Maricris operates a pedicab transportation service. She has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maricris joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Maricris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Maricris is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

--------------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 26 years old and blessed with two children who are in school. He has been running his retail shop for five years. He runs his business in a very competitive environment. He thanks Faulu Kenya for helping to grow his business and now the business is stable. He hopes that someday, he will expand his business into wholesale. He has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and soda.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, and soda.

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
Blenda M. is from the village of Santa Rosa. She is 30 years old. Blenda is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $62 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Blenda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Blenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Milinda

texts.en:
Milinda N. is from the village of Clarin Plaridel in Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Milinda is married. To make a living, Milinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Milinda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Milinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

Milinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Milinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea N., 32, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. N. produces traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of about US $3 per day. Her husband is a famer and a construction worker, earning an income of about US $3 per day. N. has to spend US $50 on food, US $5 on electricity and water supplies, and US $15 on other necessary expenses every month. N. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a plot of farmland to produce more rice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to produce rice

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 43 años, tiene un ciber en donde la hora de internet la da a $ 0.60. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Inicio su negocio hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo ya que él es guardia de seguridad. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am dando el servicio de internet y vendiendo snack. La hora de internet la cobra a $ 0.60 y las impresiones a color y blanco y negro según sea la tinta. Con el préstamo quiere comprar computadoras para hacer más grande el negocio. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Ana, 43, has a cyber café where she charges $0.60 an hour for Internet access.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo that is notable because most of its residents are merchants.

She started the business a few years ago in order to help her husband meet household expenses since he’s a security guard.  She starts work at 8am providing Internet access and selling snacks.  An hour of Internet access costs $0.60 and black and white and color copies are charged according to the type of ink used.  She wants to use the loan to buy computers to enlarge the business.  In the future she wants to build her house better.

loans.use: For computers.

loans.name: Juana Iris

texts.es:
Juana D. 24 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva como fuente para dar a su familia lo necesario y ayudar a su esposo quien también trabaja en la empresa D. Agua Alpina, tienen una hija y residen en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután.
Juana tiene más D. ocho meses D. dedicarse al comercio D. ropa, este negocio aun es pequeño por lo que ella quiere realizar una compra D. ropa y solicita un préstamo para la inversión ya que debe estar actualizando el negocio con lo último en moda como estrategia para mantener a los clientes y atraer a nuevos, su intención es ir en aumento con sus ventas y progresar cada vez más en busca D. mejorar las condiciones D. su familia.
Sueña con poseer una negocio granD. con estabilidad y con su familia desea progresar cada día para tener una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Juana is 24 years old and makes a living selling clothes. This is a way of providing what her family needs as well as helping her husband who works for Agua Alpina. They have a daughter and live in Jiquilisco in the Usulutan department.

 Juana has been selling clothes for more than eight months and it's still a small business which is why she is requesting a loan to invest. She needs to update the business with the latest fashion trends as a strategy to retain her customers as well as attract new ones. Her plan is to increase her sales and continue improving her family's quality of life. Her dream is to have a big stable business and to move her family towards a more comfortable lifestyle every day.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Desde hace 22 años David V. se desempeña como vendedor ambulante de dulces, mecato y cigarrillos, con su negocio le brinda a su familia la posibilidad de tener el sustento diario.

David quiere que su negocio tenga mayor surtido de productos y de esta manera puede conseguir nuevos clientes y para esto requiere de un crédito que le permita comprar los productos para vender.

Su sueño es tener una tienda mixta con una gran variedad de productos y esto lo podrá hacer solo cuando su actual negocio comience a crecer y a ser mas reconocido por los clientes.
texts.en: For 22 years David V. has worked as a street vendor, selling candy, lunches and cigarettes. With his business, he provides his family the possibility of having their daily bread. David wants his business to be better stocked with products in order to gain new customers, and for this he needs a loan to buy products to sell. His dream is to have a mixed store with a large variety of products. He will only be able to do this when his current business starts to grow and be known by customers.

loans.use: to purchase inputs

loans.name: Mirian Justina

texts.es:
Mirian Justina V. C. tiene 39 años de edad. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañero  y con los hijos, vive en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

 Mirian Justina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir creciendo económicamente.

Le gusta los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Mirian Justina V. C. is 39. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Mirian Justina has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to continue growing economically.

She enjoys doing the household chores.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
La señora Enma H. V. se dedica a la venta de tuberculos en el mercado toledo hace más de cinco años aproximadamente, La solicitante vive en casa alquilada con su hija el cual está en la Universidad estatal de la ciudad de Ica . Está solicitando el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando mercadería de todo tipo.
Se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buena experiencia acrediticia en otras entidades bancarias y también presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Enma H. V. has been selling tubers in the Toledo market for more than 5 years, approximately.  She lives in a rented home with her daughter who attends the state university in the city of Ica.  She is asking for a loan to invest in her business, buying merchandise of all types.  

The loan was offered to her because she has a good credit history with other banks and also presents good personal and work references.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: La Cosecha 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Bertha es la coordinadora del grupo La Cosecha 3 y 4, Grupo formado por 10 mujeres empresarias de la ciudad de Los Alcarrizos, ubicada al oeste de la provincia de Santo Domingo, siendo una de las comunidades mas pobladas y mas rurales de la capital de Republica Dominicana. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

La F. de Bertha esta compuesta por ella, su esposo y sus 3 hijos, todos comparten y viven bajo el mismo techo, de una casa humilde, en una zona de escasos recursos económicos y de servicios. Sus planes es poder tener una buena tapicería, con muchos clientes y que se puedan fabricar y vender muebles de todo tipo. Sus retos es poder educar a sus hijos y proveerles lo que necesiten para salir adelante.

Bertha se dedica a la tapicería, y a la reparación de muebles, gracias a sus conocimientos ha podido crear este negocio, un poco escaso en la zona en la que vive; desea ampliar sus servicios y fabricar muebles para vender a buen precio pero con buena calidad. Esta muy emocionada de recibir su segundo préstamo con Esperanza y con este va a invertirlo en la compra de telas, accesorios, madera y algunas herramientas que necesita para su negocio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y es un ejemplo para su F. y las demás mujeres en su grupo.
texts.en:
Bertha is the coordinator of the "La Cosecha 3 y 4" (The Harvest 3 and 4) group which is made up of 10 enterprising women from the city of Los Alcarrizos which is located in the east of Santo Domingo province.  It is one of the most populated and rural areas of the Domincan Republic's capital city.  The women mainly sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food and other miscellaneous products. 

Bertha's family consists of herself, her husband and her 3 children.  They all live under the same roof, in a humble house, in an area which is poor both in financial terms and in terms of services.  Bertha's plans are to own a good upholstery business with many customers, making and selling all kinds of furniture.  Her challenges are to educate her children and to provide them with what they need to get ahead in life.

Bertha works as an upholsterer and also repairs furniture.  Thanks to her knowledge, she has been able to create this business which is quite scarce in the area in which she lives.  She would like to expand her services and make good-quality furniture to sell at a good price.  She is very excited to be receiving her second loan from Esperanza and will invest the money in buying fabric, accessories, wood and some tools that she needs for her business.  She is a very hard-working woman and is an example for her family and the other women in her group.

loans.use: To buy fabric and accessories for upholstering furniture

loans.name: Luiz Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 59 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa ella cuida a los niños cuando el esta trabajando y de esta manera se apoyan mutuamente, tiene 2 hijos, labora para Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace 14 años como policia Municipal.    
Solicita este financiamiento con  el apoyo de Kiva a quien agradece mucho por ayuarlo de esta menera; el objetivo del credito es mejorar la casa reparacion del techo y repellar las paredes de la casa.  
Su mayor sueño es terminar de realizar todas las mejoras a la casa para que su familia tenga un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Luis is 59 years old and his wife is a homemaker who takes care of their children while he is working at the Town Hall in Juigalpa.  He has been employed there as a municipal policeman for 14 years.  They have two children.

He is requesting financial support from Kiva and is very grateful for this help.  His goal is to make home improvements by repairing the roof and water-proofing the walls of his house.

His dream is to finish all the improvements so his family can live in a more dignified environment.

loans.use: To make home improvements

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh  K. T. N.,  28 years old with one child, is living in Co Loa commune. Being a tailor, she has opened a small design fashion shop in her village and she is always busy in this shop with a lot of orders from customers.  Running it for 4 years since she received her first loan in 2008, now her shop is bigger and creates more profit. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy  cloth.

 Khanh T. N. is 42 years old with two children. She has shop that provides motorbike repair service. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to  buy more  motor bike parts.

 Ky T. N. is 55 years old with three children. She has a small shop that sells fruit in Co Loa market. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop.

 Quyen  L. T. C. is 35 years old with two children. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to buy  cloth to make clothing.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 47 years old and married with three children. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a direct selling business (Natasha and MSE products) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as clothes, cologne and shoes. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a married woman with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. For the past six years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbors and passers-by.
Milka faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season the availability of fish is higher compared to the hot summer season where the availability of fish is lower. Milka dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.
With her loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase building materials for her fish-selling stall, purchase timber, iron sheets and pay labor. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to raise her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for her fish-selling stall, purchase timber, iron sheets and pay labor.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Laura O. la cual tiene 30 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria y esta casada con el señor Herminio el cual trabaja como jornalero, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad.

Doña Laura nos platica que ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio porque lo que gana su esposo en el campo es muy poco y no alcanza para cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar. 


Ella nos platica que vende chiles rellenos y tamales los fines de semana con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella vende casa por cas y dice "Dios da para todos y siempre termino mis tamales"

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz, variedad de chiles, tomates, carne, aceite y  manteca para elaborar sus tamales y chiles para  posteriormente venderlos

ella espera que su negocio prospere cada dia y deje ganancias ya que desea invertir un poco en refrescos y a futuro poner una pequeña tiendita en su hogar.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion y envia un saludo a las personas que hacen posible estos prestamos.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, Laura O. lives in this community, she is 30, with studies of 5th grade, married to Herminio who works as a journeyman, they have two children that attend elementary school in the community.

Laura tells us that she decided to work on her own business because what her husband makes in the fields is not enough to cover the needs of their home.  

She sells stuffed peppers and tamales on the weekend to her friends and neighbors, she sells door to door and says that "God gives to everyone and I always sell out of my tamales".

Laura needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of corn, peppers, tomatoes, meat, oil and fat to make the tamales and stuffed peppers and sell them.  

She hopes that her business prospers and gives profits so that she can invest some of it in soft drinks and a have a small store in her house.  She is very thankful to the foundation and sends greetings to the people that make these loans possible.

loans.use: to purchase of corn, peppers, tomatoes, meat, oil and fat to make the tamales and stuffed peppers for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Santo Domingo surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, tiene 16 integrantes y se denomina "Mujeres Unidas", todas sus integrantes se caracterizan por su espíritu emprendedor y el esfuerzo constante que realizan por salir adelante en todas sus actividades diarias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo, por ejemplo, es la Señora Noelia E., tiene un hijo, es casada y su marido se desempeña como empleado público. Si bien él cuenta con un salario fijo mensual,  ella desea ayudarlo y se dedica a la venta de lencerías y ropas en el nuevo circuito comercial.  
En el caso de la señora Noelia, el crédito será importante porque lo utilizará para la compra de lencerías y ropas para volver a tener mayor opciones y variedad para sus clientes de la comunidad, así podrá puede mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar económicamente a la familia. 
Todas las señoras que integran el grupo también  realizan actividades productivas para ayudar a sus familias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This Santo Domingo group arose as a result of promotional activities undertaken in the area.  It has 16 members and is called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).  All the members are noted for their enterprising spirit and the constant effort they put into getting ahead in all their daily activities.

One of the group members, for example, is Mrs. Noelia E..  She has a son, is married and her husband is employed as a Public Employee.  Although he earns a stable monthly salary, she wants to help him out and sells lingerie and clothes along the new commercial circuit.

In Noelia’s case the loan will be important because she’ll use it to buy lingerie and clothes in order to once again have more options and variety available for her customers in the community as well as earning better income to help her family economically.

All the ladies that compose the group also carry out productive activities to help their families and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 47, makes every effort to see to it that her business is under her control. Not able to finish college, she is married to Marcial who works as a security guard. Together they raise two children who attend school in Tanza, Cavite.

Elsa's main activity is buying goods based on quality and affordability. She sells these items to business connections and gains a considerable amount of profit. The business has no official commercial space of its own — at least yet. She has been running this business for four years without the help of employees. Every month she earns a net income of Php6, 820.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php9, 000 to purchase more stock for her business, such as shoes and apparel. She also plans to start selling electronic loads for mobile phones across various network service providers. The profits from this business will be used in the future to invest in a house for rent.

One challenge for Elsa is inventory control. She finds it hard to make an accurate couint of her goods; she also lacks time for her family, which is very crucial. But she realizes that proper management of what she has — time and resources — is the solution to the problem. Elsa desires to see her kids finish their education and have a stable business of their own. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more shoes, clothing and cosmetics ordered in advance by her customers.

loans.name: Duo Raquel Group

texts.es:
DUO RAQUEL

Este grupo está formado por Dina de 34 años de edad ella tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la venta de chiles rellenos y venta de refacciones, en la aldea donde ella vive y el mercado de San Juan Sac. Desde hace 8 años, también esta doña María  de 26 años, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su comunidad donde ella vive desde hace 10 años, ella nos cuenta que vende todos los días en el mercado y le ha ido bien, pero ella quiere comprar más producto y tener surtido su negocio ya que hay verduras que más se vende y el tomate , también quiere hacer una su estantería para acondicionar bien su mercadería entonces quiere agrandar un poco mas ye espera que fape pueda darle la oportunidad que ella espera, confía que Dios que se le pueda apoyar.
texts.en:
DUO RAQUEL

This group is formed by Dina, 34, who has two children and has sold chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers) and snacks in the village where she lives and in the San Juan Sac Market for the last 8 years.

María, 26, is also in the group.  She has been selling vegetables in her local market for the last ten years.  She tells us that she sells in the market every day and has done well but she wants to buy more product and have the business better stocked since there are certain vegetables that sell more, and tomatoes.  She also wants to build shelving to display her wares properly and then she wants to expand a bit and hopes that Fape will provide the opportunity she hopes for and trusts that God will make it possible for her to be helped.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad,  es  conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos.  Tiene estudios hasta el 3ro de secundaria.
Con su préstamo anterior de   S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, compró  animales  vacuno y ovino.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas al paso, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará un triciclo, utensilios de cocina y víveres para la preparación de sus alimentos.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo e hijos.
Su sueño es tener una casa en Ilave y viajar a otras ciudades.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las charlas que imparte la Promotora.
texts.en:
Apolinaria is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Concepción," located in the population center of Ayruma Carumas of the Acora district in the province of Puno and department of Puno. She is 35 years old, lives in a committed relationship and has four children. She has studied through the third year of middle school. 

With her previous loan of S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, she bought cattle and sheep. Currently she sells fast food to pedestrians and has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one cycle now. With this new loan of S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles she will purchase a tricycle, kitchen utensils and supplies for making her foods. Her husband and children help her in the business. 

Her dream is to have a house in Ilave and travel to other cities. 

What she likes about the communal bank are its trainings and the talks given by the Facilitator.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle, kitchen utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Alva Rosa

texts.en: Alva lives in Danli, Honduras, where she earns a living by preparing and selling homemade baked goods. She has run this small business for the last 12 years, and primarily bakes bread as well as a local snack called rosquilla. Alva is a returning client and has a punctual payment history on her previous loans. She is currently requesting a loan of 14,000 Honduran lempiras (LPS) to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, eggs, butter, sugar, milk and cheese.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van, age 50, lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. To earn a living, she and her husband plant and harvest crops, thereby earning around $2 in profit to be used toward providing for the needs of the family. The couple is shown here with their youngest child. They have ten children, one of whom is married and living separately. 

In order to generate additional income, four of their children are employed as garment factory workers and contribute their monthly salaries to the family. 

Mrs. Van is requesting a loan with which she will make essential repairs to the old house in which the family lives.

loans.use: to make essential repairs to the old house in which the family lives

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Growing his business and achieving a better way of living is the greatest dream of Eduardo. He is 49 years old, married with one school-aged child. His wife is a housekeeper.

Eduardo has been running a hog-raising business for over five years. He earns approximately  P 2,000 per head every four months. Eduardo is requesting a loan of P 7,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. 

Eduardo keeps on working hard and improving his strategy in running his business to achieve his dream: a better way of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Leh Den Help We Group

texts.en:
The leader of the “Leh Den Help We” group, Fatmata is 38, married and has one child in secondary school. Her husband is a businessman. She was born in the city of Makeni but she now lives in Waterloo in western Sierra Leone.

For sixteen years now, Fatmata has been selling clothes. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy clothes in bulk to boost her business.

In this photo are members of her group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This is these entrepreneurs’ first loan from SMT. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more money and consequently improve on their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Carinsan

texts.en:
Carinsan is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 2 children. 
Carinsan has a tailoring shop that makes & repairs office & school uniforms. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Carinsan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carinsan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Thank God Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in Freetown city, the 30-year-old is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader and one of her children is attending primary school. Zainab sells cosmetics, jewelry, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Zainab and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Zainab will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy cosmetics and jewelry in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry in large quantities

loans.name: Duterimbere/nymgn Group

texts.fr:
Fulgence  fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/NYMGN. Le nom du groupe signifie «  ». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant de 1 an. 

Fulgence est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres terrains de champs du riz afin d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Fulgence voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fulgence is a member of Duterimbere/NYMGN Group. He's 32 years old, married, and has one child, who is one year old.

Fulgence is a rice cultivator, and he is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growth is to buy other lots in the paddy field in order to increase his production. In the forthcoming years, Fulgence would like to be among the best rice cultivators in his valley. He plans to use his profits to provide his children with education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 27-year-old single man living with his cousin. 

He has owned a snack shop in his town since 2008. He prepares tasty sandwiches such as chicken and beef and he also makes pizza. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new oven for pizza baking. He has a great demand for pizza and he plans to increase his business productivity in order to gain a superior income.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven for pizza baking.

loans.name: Rosalem

texts.en:
Rosalem is married with 2 children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalem is 28 years old. 

Rosalem has a sari-sari (general goods) store in the Philippines. Rosalem requested a PHP 20 000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Rosalem has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosalem would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la Asociación  Arariwa. Yolanda sigue con el negocio D. siembra y cosecha D. café.

Yolanda con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el negocio. 

Yolanda requiere el préstamo para pagar a los peones que trabajan en la chacra. 


Yolanda se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Yolanda continues participating in Asociación Arariwa’s micro loan unit’s “Qorichaska del Cusco” communal bank.  She continues with her coffee growing business.  Yolanda did very well with her previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits so she now wants another loan because it’s very helpful for her business.
