Yolanda needs the loan to pay day laborers that work her fields. Yolanda is grateful for the opportunity provided her through this means and pledges to make her installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay day laborers that work her fields.

loans.name: Eimy Damari

texts.es:
la sra. Eimy Damari tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha procreado 2 hijos, Junto con su esposo se dedican a la caficultura, su esposo tiene 5 años de experiencia y tienen 6 manzanas de tierra, de las cuales 1 y media son productoras de café, 2 manzanas para el pasto de animales, y 2 y media manzanas son para el cultivo de sus granos básicos.
Eimy utilizara el credito para comprar su propio panel de energia solar, ellos se alumbran con candiles y en ocasiones con velas: Eimy piensa que va a tener un mejor futuro para sus hijos si cuenta con su propia energía.
texts.en:
Eimy Damari is 21 years old and is in a common-law marriage that has produced 2 children.  She cultivates coffee along with her husband.  Her husband has 5 years of experience, and has about 10 acres of land.  She has about 2 acres where she is growing coffee, 4 acres where she is growing pasture grass for animal feed, and about 4 acres where she is growing staple grains. 

Eimy will use this loan to buy her own solar energy panel. Their source of light now is lanterns and, at times, candles.  Eimy thinks that she is going to have a better future for her children if she can count on her own source of energy.

loans.use: to buy solar energy equipment

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a small farmer in her local community. She is a very industrious worker who has been engaged in this business with her husband for 10 years. This is their main source of income and they support their family through the proceeds from their farm.
 
Due to lack of finances, Lorna is asking for a loan amount P15,000 to buy inputs needed on the farm, including two bags of seeds, a liter of insecticides, and fertilizers, and to pay for the labor of an additional worker who will sow and plow the farm.  

Through their sacrifices, patience, and hard work, Lorna is confident that they will achieve progress and success.

loans.use: to buy inputs needed on the farm, including two bags of seeds, a liter of insecticides, and fertilizers, and to pay for the labor of an additional farm worker

loans.name: Knkush

texts.en:
Knkush is from Ninotsminda, South Georgia. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband, two daughters (18 and 17 years old), a son (12 years old), and parents-in-law (retired).  Knkush’s children go to school. They receive monthly social assistance from the government, as they live in poverty.  Knkush leads the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them.  In particular, the family owns 2 milk cows. They sell milk locally.  Also, Knkush grows potatoes on a family-owned plot of land.  These are also sold locally. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Knkush requested credit for purchasing materials for changing the roof of the house. The old roof is in bad condition and can’t keep rain and snow out of the house. The family needs to change it in order to keep the house warm during winter months.

loans.use: to purchase materials for changing the roof of the house

loans.name: Firmine

texts.en:
Firmine is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has six children.
 
Firmine has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Firmine has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Firmine hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old, married, and has one kid. Manuel’s wife is a housekeeper. He has been engaged in the farming business since he was married. He plants and harvests rice.

Manuel wishes for a better way of living for his family. He always finds a way so that his family will not suffer financial shortage. He doesn’t want them to starve because, as a head of the family, he is the one who will provide for the needs of the family.

Manuel wants to achieve his wish. He will continue develop his practice in farming and get a better yield. To achieve his wish, Manuel is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and insecticides. He believes that the loan will have a positive impact for his farming business.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Eart

texts.en: Eart, 36, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who raises chickens and pigs. Her husband helps her run the business. Eart is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase animal feed for her chickens and pigs, which she will then sell when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm, build a new house, and support her children's education until they earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed for chickens and pigs, which she will sell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Tuoi

texts.en:
Tuoi and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 48 and has four sons. Her husband earns an income as a truck driver.

Tuoi has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of their house for the past seven years. She sells a variety of basic goods such as sugar, confectioneries, and basic household necessities. 

Tuoi would like to borrow money to expand her business and hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of basic goods and household necessities to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 17 years. In 1998, Aminata established her local food stuff (rice, beans) business. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women from up country. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 850,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL so that she can buy more bags of rice and beans. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy beans. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Alogojesuston 7 Group

texts.fr: ALOGOJESUSTON 7 est un groupement composé de huit personnes qui sont résident dans un même quartier. Assiba Jeanne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 63 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Assiba Jeanne est une veuve, mère de quatre enfants. Certains parmi ces enfants sont scolarisés. Assiba Jeanne vit avec ses enfants, les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par dame Assiba Jeanne. Pour y arriver, Assiba Jeanne vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques par la méthode  de distribution depuis sept ans.  Assiba Jeanne s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Assiba Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOGOJESUSTON 7 un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et des tissus.

loans.name: España Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPAÑA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: salón de belleza, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de calzados, venta de jugos, venta de deportivos, venta de frutas, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de polleras (faldas de mujer); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga a quien solicitó que le enseñara la elaboración, cuando obtuvo el conocimiento decidió invertir un capital para la implementación de un taller de confección. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “España” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of ten members and is directed by an executive board of which Victoria is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among these exist: a beauty salon, transportation services, food sales, footwear sales, juice sales, sportswear sales, fruit sales, and traditional skirt sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business entrepreneurs of which Victoria is a member. She indicates that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling polleras (women’s skirts). She makes it known that she learned this business from a friend who she requested to teach her their production. When she obtained the knowledge, she decided to invest capital in the implementation of a dressmaking workshop.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (to purchase cloth wholesale) which she will acquire from the wholesale sellers from the city of La Paz and subsequently she will sell the product in her store. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has three children.

When she is consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health, the training, and the loan that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Belesi's Group

texts.en:
Belisi, featured in the picture above, is representing her farming group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 48 years old and a married mother of 6 children. She is often described as a very hardworking individual.

Although Belisi has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and learn about new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Belisi wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits from this season’s harvest, Belisi hopes to be able to buy more land for cultivation.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights; though Belisi decided not to get one, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Gia

texts.en: Retailing helped Gia survive for the family. She retails consumable goods and brings a meager income of Php 14,900 per month. She found the business of buying and selling consumable goods easy. Gia plans to expand her retailing business. She applied a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Gia smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to start a clothing business/boutique

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona has a business selling all types of gifts for girls' quinceañeras, baptisms and weddings. She also sells school supplies. She has one year of experience. She took out a loan from a lending institution to start her business. The business is in her home and she tends to it every day of the week.

She would use the loan to buy school supplies since the school season is starting. With the earnings she generates she will be able to make improvements to her business premises.

Ramona is 31 years old. She has 3 children. Her husband abandoned her 5 years ago. She was not able to make ends meet with the monthly payments her husband was sending her, so she had to look for another solution. Currently she is both mother and father for her children. Her desire is to grow the business in order to be able to keep her children in school and continue making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ramona tiene un negocio de venta de todo tipo de regalos para: quinceañera, bautizo, matrimonio, también vende útiles escolares. Tiene una experiencia de 1 años. Ella saco un préstamo en una institución que brinda este servicio. El negocio lo tiene en su misma casa y lo atiende todos los días de la semana.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar: útiles escolares que se inicia la temporada de clase. Con los ingresos generados podrá hacer mejoras en su local.

La señora tiene 31 años. Tiene 3 niñas. Su esposo la abandono hace 5 años. Con las mensualidades que su esposo le mandaba no le alcanzaba y tuvo que buscar que hacer. Actualmente ella es padre y madre para sus hijos. Su deseo es incrementar el negocio para poder mantener a sus hijos en la escuela y seguir adecuando su casa.

loans.use: Buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy 10 sheeps

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta Pelicó P. is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Manuela rents her two little plots of land for about US$316/year, and grows onions and ornamental flower. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only about 15% of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others to make ends meet.

Berta's has simple goals: She'd like to someday get just a little cash saved up. And a far-reaching dream would be to buy a piece of her own land, which would cost the nearly unthinkable sum of US$1000 or more. Berta, 51, speaks mostly her native Quiché, but also speaks a good bit of Spanish, which she learned out of necessity in her work life. She didn't go to school as a girl and does not read or write. Cultivating crops is all she knows, but at least now she can work the fields at least a little bit for her own account, instead of working all the time for others.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for onion and flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Supriadi

texts.id:
Supriadi lives in a rented place. There are about 50 rooms, very crowded. There is an inside bathroom, kitchen, a bedroom and a living room. The living room is also his place of business. Usually the customers come to Pak (Mr.) Supri (nickname) asking for jacket to be sewn. The cost to sew a jacket is between Rp50,000.00-70,000.00 (US$ 5.50-7.70) depending on difficulty. if orders are slow, Pak Supri would also takes orders from an artshop in Ktua. For transportation Pak Supri uses his motor cycle to pick up and delivers the orders. Supriadi lives with his wife and two son and daughter. His son is in 9th grade (3rd class middle school), and his daughter in 1st grade. His wife used to work in a Taylor shop, but has to give up to bring and pick up the children to school. However she is helping him with sewing too. The capital that would be received would be used to buy another sewing machine, so that the sewing process could be done faster, also completing more orders. So far Pak Supri only receive orders, with raw materials brought by the customers. However, he plans to make shirts from his own raw materials and sell it in the artshop. This will increase his business and creativity.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Supriadi tinggal di sebuah rumah kos. Ada sekitar 50 kamar, sangat padat. Ada kamar mandi dalam, dapur, satu kamar tidur dan satu ruang tamu. Ruang tamu inilah tempat usahanya. Biasanya pelanggan sendiri yang datang ke rumah Pak Supri, minta dijahitkan jaket. Ongkos jahit satu jaket antara Rp 50.000,00 – Rp 70.000,00, tergantung tingkat kesulitannya. Kalau sepi pesanan. Pak Supri mengambil pesanan dari artshop di Kuta. Sebagai alat transportasi, Pak Supri menggunakan sepeda motor untuk mengambil dan mengantar pesanan. Supriyadi tinggal bersama isteri dan kedua putra putrinya. Putranya kelas 3 SMP dan Putrinya kelas 1 SD. Isterinya pernah kerja di Taylor, tetapi karena anaknya sekolah, dia harus mengantar dan menjemput anaknya di sekolah. Isterinya sendiri ikut membantu suaminya menjahit. Modal yang didapat akan dibelikan mesin jahit lagi. Supaya proses menjahitnya lebih cepat, pesanan yang bisa diselesaikan juga semakin banyak. Mengenai bahan baku, untuk saat ini Pak Supri hanya menerima pesanan. Jadi bahannya dibawa oleh yang memesan. Namun, dia berencana untuk bisa membuat baju dari bahan yang dia punyai sendiri untuk dijual di artshop. Hal ini tentu akan lebih membuka peluang baginya untuk lebih mengembangkan usaha dan kreatifitasnya.

loans.use:
To buy a sewing machine

Membeli mesin jahit.

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Faapaia is 27 years old and single. She lives with her father and three brothers. She used to work as a school teacher, but, when her mother passed away 6 months ago, Faapaia decided to stay home to look after her sick father. She also decided to earn money on her own that would let her be financially independent of her brothers. Faapaia is therefore asking for a loan of US$475 to improve her small restaurant business. This is Faapaia's second loan with SPBD, and she is very delighted that her business is going well.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and materials for a pancake business

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: "Women can not do without making their hair," says Mrs. Justina I., who owns a salon where she braids and fixes hair for people.  She is also into the pedicure and manicure business.  She is 36 years old, married and has one child.  She lives in Benin City and requests a loan of $450 to enable her buy to more weave-on, relaxers and hair cream to sell.  She has been in business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more weave-on, relaxer hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 47 years old, is living with her 3 children in Kim Dong, Hung Yen. Her husband caught a fatal disease and passed away. She on her own struggled to raise her children to maturity and to send them to school. Her youngest child is still going to school now. She mainly uses the money borrowed from the Fund in breeding the chickens. Mrs. L. already has 200 chickens ready to be released from the coop for the Tet holiday. Besides, she also works on 2 hectares of rice field. Her income has increased from 30 USD to 125 USD/month after 3 years joining the Fund. She wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more chicken feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lẫm năm nay 47 tuổi sống cùng với 3 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chồng chị mắc bệnh hiểm nghèo không may qua đời, một mình chị L. lũ nuôi các con ăn học trưởng thành. Hiện nay con út của chị vẫn đang đi học. Nguồn vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị sử dụng chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi gà. Trong chuồng gà nhà chị Lẫm có 200 con gà đang chuẩn bị được xuất chuồng trong dịp Tết. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn làm 2 mẫu ruộng. Thu nhập của chị Lẫm đã tăng từ 30USD lên 125USD/tháng sau 3 năm tham gia Quỹ. Chị muốn vay 575USD để mua thức ăn cung cấp cho đàn gà của mình.

loans.use: Buy chicken feed

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel owns a service shop for public transportation vehicles, which is his only source of income. His staff consists of three employees. Daniel supports his young four-year-old son and his wife. His house is located in the Luiz Espinal zone in the city of El Alto.

The credit will be used to purchase materials for the shop like springs, hydraulic liquids, and other items.

This is Daniel's first credit with Impro. The evaluation done means that he has been approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Daniel posee un taller de servicio (su única fuente de ingreso) para vehículos particulares y de servicio público, asimismo, su personal consta de 3 empleados. Daniel mantiene a su pequeño hijo de 4 años y a su esposa. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Luis Espinal de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requerido será destinado a la compra de materia prima para el taller. Por ejemplo muelles, líquidos hidráulicos y otros.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada permite aprobar la solicitud del prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 29 years old. He has two children, and one of them was born 8 months ago. He is living in a rented house and has a barbershop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new furniture and mirrors and paint the shop. He wants to make some advertising in order to expand his project and increase his income and improve himself.

loans.use: Purchase new furniture and mirrors.

loans.name: Jehova Provee Group

texts.en:
Josefina lives in San Pedro de Macoris with her husband and six children (ages: 21,16,15,12,9,4). Currently she is running a small salon, and selling both sheets and curtains to families in her community or other passers-by. She wants to use this loan to by materials to make sheets and curtains for her little shop. Josefina’s dream for the future is to own her own cafeteria, where she can prepare and sell food to people for breakfast and lunch. She said that her main stuggle right now is saving up enough money to start the cafeteria, but she believes that it will happen soon.

This is the first loan that these ten people of Jehova Provee are applying for, and they are excited to see it go to good use in their various business and homes. We all want to extend our thanks to Kiva for continually supporting the women of the Dominican Republic. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy materials for curtains and sheets.

loans.name: Hariyani

texts.id:
Hariyani lives with her husband in a rented room. In front of this room, she opens a small food kiosk, which sells rice dishes, basic commodities and drinks. She has worked on this business for about a year. Before that, she worked as a tailor, but she decided to start her own business to increase her income. Hariyani's living space is clean, and she is quite resilient and good at arranging and cleaning her kiosk. Most of her customers are regulars who live around her neighborhood. Hariyani really hope that she can receive this loan, which will be used to increase her kiosk's inventory, especially to buy rice because rice is the main commodity wanted by her neighbors.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Klien bersama suaminya saar ini mengontrak sebuah kamar dan didepan kamar itu dia membuka warung kecil untuk berjualan. Jenis jualannya bermacam-macam; nasi campur, sembako, juga minuman. Usaha ini baru ditekuni sekitar 1 tahun yang lalu. Sebelumnya klien bekerja sebagai penjahit, tetapi memutuskan untuk memulai usha baru untuk menambah penghasilan. Tempat tinggalnya cukup bersih, dan klien cukup ulet dan pinter mengatur dan membersihkan warungnya. Kebanyakan konsumennya sudah menjadi langganannya, terutama mereka yang tinggal di daerah sekitar tempat tinggalnya. Klien sangat berharap diberi pinjaman unutuk dipakai memperbanyak isi warungnya, terutama membeli beras, karena beras merupakan kebutuhan pokok yang banyak dicari warga sekitar.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Edilov

texts.en:
Edilov Q., 57, owns dairy cows and sells milk to the local milk factory. He also drives tractors for local farmers, especially during the harvesting seasons. He is married and has six children.

Mr. Q. is requesting a loan to purchase two more dairy cows. This will increase the volume of milk he can sell to the local factory, thus increasing his sales and profit to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows to increase milk production

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga C. Por Y., 35, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to friends, relatives and the village community three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~120 USD). She has two previous loans with SPBD; these loans are Aiga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business, which she operates with help from her husband, who farms the plantation and also recruits employees for the plantation.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of equipment (shovels, pesticides, knives) for her taro/banana business.

loans.name: Mariam's Motivation Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one 10-year-old child. She also takes care of two other children aged 6 and 16 years old. She became a used-clothes-seller in 1998. Every day, she works from 10 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zamzam, who also has a business running a shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Sesame Rice Crackers, Livestock, Rice Noodles, Clothes, Wholesale Retail Group

texts.vi:
chị Vũ thị Tính năm nay 36 tuổi Ms 13050020, vợ chồng chị có 2 con, cả 2 con chị còn nhỏ và đang đi học. Hàng ngày chị và chồng làm nghề tráng bánh đa để bán và chăn nuôi thêm tại nhà. Chị đã vay vốn qua một C. kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt, C. kỳ này chị lại tiếp tục đăng ký vay ở mức 4.256.000 VND để mua gạo tráng bánh. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị N. thị Chung Ms 13050007 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để chăn nuôi và tráng bánh phở
  • chị Đặng thị Dinh Ms 13050008 vay mức 3.360.000 VND mua vải may quần áo bán
  • chị C. thị Bắc Ms 13050009 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Liệu Ms 13050010 vay mức 4.704.000 VND vay vốn trồng trọt, chăn nuôi .
texts.en:
Mrs. Tinh Thi V. is 36 years old. She and her husband have two small children, both of whom are going to school. Each day she and her husband make sesame rice crackers to sell and also raise livestock to supplement their income. She has already completed one funding round and has repaid the loan with good conduct. In this round of funding she is registering again for a loan, in the amount of 4,256,000 VND to buy more rice to make the crackers. Her group also includes the following participants:

  • Mrs. Chung Thi Nghiem, requesting 4,704,000 VND to raise livestock and make rice noodles.
  • Mrs. Dinh Thi Dang, requesting 3,360,000 VND to buy fabric for making clothes to sell.
  • Mrs. Bac Thi C., requesting 3,808,000 VND to use as capital for wholesale retail business.
  • Mrs. Lieu Thi Nguyen, requesting 4,704,000 VND to grow plants to sell, and to raise livestock.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more rice, fabric, buy wholesale goods

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom N. is a 44 year old mother of three in Trapaing Chum Village, Kampong Chhnang Province. She works as a farmer, while one of her children is employed in a garment factory and the others are attending a local school. She is currently facing a problem because her plantation is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Prom N. has asked for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Pol Ny, is a laborer in ice factory as well as pig breeder.  Previously, Mrs. Prom N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy three piglets for her husband's pig breeding business which she successfully paid back. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sowra A 2002-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose A.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rose is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a polceman. She has 5 children ranging from age 9 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Rose is joined in her small group by Esther M., Lucia A. , Seidia C., and Siama S.. Esther M. has a business in selling bread and wants to expand her business. Lucia A. is currently operating a business selling bread and charcoal and wants a loan to open a bar. Seidia C. operates a business of selling selling cold drinks like soda, juice, etc. and wants to expand the business. Siama S. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea at a resturant and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: 01 Phố 1- Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs H. Thị Hường is the group leader for group 01, town 1, Đông Sơn district. The group has 5 members. Mrs Hường was born in 1975. Her husband is Mr Trần Anh Tuấn, born in 1970. They have a son, Trần Anh Thuý. He is in grade 8. Mrs Hường makes incense sticks. Her husband is a construction worker. She is seeking a loan of 1.626.900 VND to invest in her incense shop. Other members in her group are all from the same town:

* Mrs B. Thị Sáu, born in 1963. She sells groceries.
* Mrs N. Thị Liên, she and her husband want to open a bike repair shop. 
* Mrs N. Thị Viên, she and her family want to open a shop to sell rice.
* Mrs N. Thị Nhung, she and her family sell rice, rice paper and raise livestock.

 Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer


Nhóm 01 - Phố 1, phường Đông Sơn gồm 5 thành viên. Chị H. Thị Hường là nhóm trưởng, MS 0016. Chị Hường sinh năm 1975. Chồng chị là Trần Anh Tuấn sinh năm 1970. Anh chị có 1 cháu trai là Trần Anh Thuý. Cháu đang học lớp 8. Chị làm nghề làm hương, chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây, chị đang vay mức vốn 1626900VND để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng làm hương. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm cùng ở phố 1 phường Đông Sơn và có cùng mức vay: Chị B. Thị Sáu sinh năm 1963, MS 0017. Gia đình chị vay vốn để bán hàng tạp hoá Chị N. Thị Liên, MS 0019. Anh chị vay vốn để mở cửa hàng nhỏ sữa chữa xe đạp Chị N. Thị Viên, MS 0018. Gia đình chị vay vốn để mở cửa hành bán gạo Chị N. Thị Nhung, MS 0020. Gia đình chị vay vốn để buôn bán gạo, chăn nuuôi làm bánh đa

loans.use: To invest in her incense store

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Señor de Huanca Village Bank. She is 40 years old and lives with her partner and their child. Carmen buys grains in Ayacucho’s Nery Market, then sells them in the city of Pisco, which is about seven hours from Ayacucho. Carmen works alone and rents trucks or trailers to transport her merchandise. She has had her business for the past fifteen years. 

Carmen is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles to buy more grains to bring to Pisco. Her goal for the future is to build her own home on a plot of land she owns.

loans.use: Buy grains to sell in Pisco

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Asghar Ali Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is a 33-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 35 years. She completed her education up to 10th standard then she married a man whose name is A. A.. Basically he is a farmer and takes land on contract and grows various vegetables. When the vegetables are ripe, he harvests them and sells them at the market, earning income. Parveen baji has no children so she handles all the household work and helps her husband in growing the crops. She is applying for a loan to take land on contract to grow vegetables for sale.

Parveen Akhtar baji is the leader of her loan group. The other member, Shahnaz baji, wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To take land on contract to grow plants

loans.name: Amuna

texts.en:
Amuna H., 30 years old and married to a carpenter, has four children, all attending school. Currently in the business of selling bread, she is requesting a loan to expand the enterprise.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokly K., 28, and her husband, Mr. Rithy Moeung, 32, who live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, were married in 2000 and have two sons. One is in school and the another is still too young. 
 
Sokly has been weaving silk since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Sokly also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. Sokly has only one loom which makes it difficult for her to earn enough income to support her family. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to set up one more loom for her husband to weave and supplement her family’s income.

loans.use: To set up a loom for her husband.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is 47 years old, single and resides at Bagakay, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She enjoys tilling her rice field which became a source of income. Emma has been a member of Paglaum under its microfinance program since October 2007. She has promptly repaid her loans and applied recently for PHP 5,000 as her 3rd loan.  The amount will be used for chemicals and fertilizers. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and to save enough for her future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Diana Jeaneth

texts.es:
La joven Diana Jeaneth V. C. tiene 20 años de edad y vive en union libre con el señor Asael Eliu Sabillon Pineda con el han procreado un hijo que tiene dos años de edad.
ella es una persona muy emprendedora y dinamica se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos desde hace 1 año, le ha hido muy bien, ella vende la mercaderia en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo,
su medio de tranporte para la venta de su mercaderia es en bicicleta.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para semana santa y asi poder obtener mas utilidades y suplir los pedidos de sus clientes.
su pasatiempo favorito es jugar con su hijo y ademas desea comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Diana Jeaneth V. C. is 20 years old and lives with her partner, Asael Eliu Sabillon Pineda, with whom she has a 2-year old son. She is a highly enterprising and dynamic individual who has successfully made a living over the last year selling clothes and cosmetics in the suburbs and districts of San Lorenzo. She carries her wares by bicycle. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise for Holy Week and in doing so increase her profits and better meet customer demand. Her favorite hobby is playing with her son and she would like to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is forty-four years old; she is married with three kids. Currently, the kids are in school. She lives with her family at Bawjiase in Ghana. Lydia is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She trades in garden eggs (small eggplants) and pepper at Bawjiase market. She treks to Kumasi and nearby villages to purchase bulk stocks from farmers and retails to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock at a time to make enough profit to support her family.

With the loan, she wants to purchase garden eggs and peppers in bulk to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her kids in school. She is member of the group called Shining Star Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure more "garden eggs" and peppers

loans.name: Giancarlo

texts.es:
Giancarlo tiene 23 años, es padre de un precioso bebé, vive con su pareja en la casa de su abuela. 
Cuenta con un pequeño restaurante, donde trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana, quien tiene una muy buen sazón, atienden a sus comensales desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En esta actividad llevan un periodo de 3 años y les va muy bien, además que le gusta mucho su trabajo, por ello que atiende a sus clientes con una gran sonrisa. Durante este tiempo, tanto por la atención, como por la calidad de la comida que ofrecen, han podido conseguir clientes regulares, lo que les da la esperanza de que con mayor esfuerzo, podrá lograr que su establecimiento se convierta en un restaurante muy reconocido, grande y más elegante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mesas, sillas, materiales de cocina y mejorará el ambiente de su pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
Giancarlo is 23 years old, a father of a beautiful baby. He lives with his spouse at his grandmother's house. He has a small restaurant where he works with the help of his sister who is very good at seasoning. They start serving at 6:00 am until 4:00 pm. They have been doing this for a period of 3 years and are doing well, and they also enjoy their work very much and serve their clients with a huge smile. Because of the attention as well as the quality of the food they have regular clients which make them feel that with more effort they will be able to turn their establishement into a well-known, big, and very elegant restaurant. This is their first loan with MFP and with the money requested they will buy tables, chairs, kitchenware, and improve the atmosphere of their small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and utensils for a restaurant.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La señora Raquel González, tiene la edad 32 años habita en le barrio, Las Enramadas, junto a su esposo el cual  trabaja, para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo una niña de doce años la cual estudia actualmente su secundaria, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hijas con sus estudios doña Raquel desde hace 5 años trabaja como comerciante, vende ropa, zapatos, adornos entre otros,  Con el financiamiento obtenido va a compra materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder tener una vivienda digna, este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por los beneficios obtenido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel González is 32 years old and lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood with her husband. He works to help with the household expenses. They care for a 12-year-old girl who is in high school. Their plans for the future include improving their living conditions and providing for their daughters' educations. Raquel has worked the past five years selling clothing, shoes, and home decor among other things. With the loan they are requesting they will buy construction materials to make some improvements on the building where they live in order make it livable. This is her sixth loan with Afodenic and she is grateful for the many benefits she has received to date.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve their home

loans.name: Ahrorkhoja

texts.en:
R. Ahrorkhoja is 25 years old. Ahrorkhoja has his own grocery store and sells different kinds of foodstuff like: macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, detergents and many others. He started this business seven years ago with the small inventory. He has become very successful. Today Ahrorkhoja is requesting a loan of $3000. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

-------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuff to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek C., 63, is a local farmer who raises pigs in a stall next to her house to earn a living. She is able to sell each mature pig to a buyer four months after she begins raising it. Her husband jointly cares for their family’s pig.

This couple has given birth to three children who are married and have ready started new homes and they are all employed in different occupations.

Because the pig-raising business is the main source of family income, Sek C. would like a loan of $700 which will be used to buy more piglets to raise. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to build a pigpen.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum P. is a 56-year-old woman. She lives in the town of Takeo province and is married and has two children. Sum P. was not available for the photo and so her husband is pictured instead.

Together, Sum P. and her husband hire out chairs, tables and other items when there is a wedding taking place. Sum P. has been engaged in this business for over thirteen years and they typically make a combined income of about US$5 per day. The couple is also supported by two of their children who are working. 

Sum P. joined CREDIT MIF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from CREDIT. She is requesting a loan of US$1,200 which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, tables and wedding materials

loans.name: Irma Dora

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 3 hijos, ella estudio educación superior (bachiller en educación primaria), vive en el Barrio las Cruces.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con lo cual pudo adquirir víveres para la preparación de comidas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de servicio de llamadas y lo hace exclusivamente en las minas la Rinconada ya que nos indica que gana muy bien, por lo que comprara créditos para sus celulares.

Su deseo es poner un locutorio en el centro de la ciudad.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de creditos para celulares.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: El Sr. Christian D.  cuenta con una movilidad la cual trabaja como radio taxista con que mantiene a su familia que vive en la ciudad de El Alto en la casa de sus suegros, es el unico ingreso que tiene la familia ya que la esposa es ama  de casa no trabaja.  la movilidad obtuvo con un prestamo bancario el cual termina de cancelar el mes de Septiembre,   durante todo el tiempo que a trabajado junto a la institucion siempre a demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion.  El prestamo lo invertira en la construccion de un garage en su casa ya que tiene que guardar la movilidad en otro lugar y el saldo para la compra de llantas.
texts.en:
Christian D. has a vehicle, which he uses to work as a taxi driver to support his family. He lives in the city of El Alto in his in-laws house. His income is the only one the family has because his wife is a house wife and does not work. He got his vehicle with a bank loan, which he will finish paying off in September. During the entire time that he has worked with the institution, he has always shown himself to be a hard worker with the desire to succeed. He will use the loan to build a garage on his house because he has to keep the vehicle in another place. He will use the rest to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a garage at his house and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a bagoong  (processed and fermented fish) vendor.  She is 55 years old and married to Rolando Sr., a farmer.  The couple have four children, and two of them are still studying.  Marina is still active in managing her buy and sells business of bagoong or sometimes called fish sauce. 

She is requesting to avail loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will be of big help in the improvement of her business which is very in demand in their village.  She buys bagoong all the way from the province of Pangasinan and retails in their village at Barangay Cebu San Isidro, Isabela. She hopes to develop her business to progress to able increase her income that is being used for the completion of education of her two younger children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba M. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Boucotte Face Néma depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 16 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec ce crédit elle va approvisionner sa cantine en marchandise telle que de l'oignon, carottes, et autres légumes et de l'huile de palme. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalisera lui permettrons de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Diénaba M., 42, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Boucotte Face Néma for 7 years and has received 16 loans that she has always reimbursed without problems. With this loan she is going to replenish merchandise in her little store, for example, onions, carrots, and other vegetables, and palm oil. The profit she will make will permit her to contribute to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improving her little business

loans.name: C8687 Duharanirekujyambere Group

texts.en:
Uwimana F. is 43 years old and married with 8 children, aged 2 through 21 years old.  Together they live in the Rubavu district in Gisenyi province, near Kigali. 

Uwimana's business employs 7 other people in her community and has been in existence since 1999, making this her 10 year anniversary of successful operation! The hours of her successful retail banana business are from 8AM - 5PM daily.  She serves locals and passers-by delicious, fresh bananas and for this she projects a monthly profit of 40,000 RWF (approximately US$ 80).  This loan will help her to buy more inventory and get better pricing which will help her to become more profitable and efficient.  

This is Uwimana's second loan from VFC and her previous loan was repaid in full and on time.  She is grateful to VFC and Kiva for their support of her business.

loans.use: More  bananas for resale

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en: Anelyn M. is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Anelyn buy’s coconut shells to process into charcoal and sell in the public market. She has been engaged in this business for six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In February 2009, Anelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anelyn is now requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP as additional capital for her existing business and to try expanding the business in volume. She wishes to serve other neighboring towns, too, with her charcoal. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the financial needs of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut shells to make charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Inmaculada se formó en la ciudad de Manta en la provincia de Manabí, este es un puerto marítimo muy visitado por los turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de  sus habitantes  viven de la pesca artesanal.

María está casada desde hace 19 años tiene dos hijos, nos cuenta que ella nació en Cojimies una bella población de la provincia Manabita y que se radió en Manta hace 22 años,  siempre está en contacto con sus padres que la vienen a visitar o ella viaja a su tierra natal  pues le gusta mucho disfrutar las playas de esa zona norte de la región.

La señora María  Isabel vive en  la ciudadela el Palmar en la urbe mantense, ella junto a su esposo se dedican desde hace seis años al restaurant,  sus  labores empiezan  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las  9 de la noche de lunes a sábado,  ofrecen desayunos, almuerzos y en la tarde solo cosas para picar como sánduches, café y postres; aquí las actividades son compartidas ella se encarga de la preparación de los alimentos  siendo su especialidad  los mariscos  y su esposo  es el encargado de servir a los clientes y hacer las compras para el restaurant.

María Isabel  está solicitando un nuevo préstamo a la Fundación Espoir con la finalidad de invertir en el restaurant ya quiere darle un toque diferente como cambiar la vajilla, colocar unos cuadros, y darle un toque navideño de acuerdo a la  época para captar y dar un mejor servicio a su exigente clientela.

María está dedicada 100% a su trabajo  y  ha venido preparándose  en conocer más de la gastronomía,  su sueño es  terminar sus estudios de chef
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada (Immaculate Mary) Community Bank is located in the city of Manta, province of Manabí. This maritime port is frequented by national and foreign tourists alike, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living from fishing. María Isabel has been married for 19 years and has two children. She tells us she was born in Cojimies, a beautiful village in the province, and moved to Manta 22 years ago. She is always in contact with her parents, who come visit her or she visits in her birth city, since she really enjoys the beaches in the northern part of the region. María and her husband have made a living the past six years with their restaurant. Their work begins at 7 in the morning and goes until 9 in the evening Monday through Saturday. They offer breakfast and lunches, and in the afternoon offer smaller items like sandwiches, deserts and coffee. They share the responsibilities. María is in charge of preparing the meals, her specialty being seafood, and her husband serves the customers and makes the purchases for the restaurant. María is requesting a new loan from Kiva partner Foundacion Espoir and plans to invest in the restaurant, since she wants to give it a different touch like changing the dishes, putting up some pictures and adding a little Christmas theme to go with the season in order to capture and provide better service to her discerning clientele. She is 100 percent dedicated to her work and has been preparing herself to learn even more about gastronomy. Her dream is to finish her studies as a chef.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new dishes, pictures and Christmas decorations for her restaurant

loans.name: Rakela

texts.en: Rakela S. is currently in the business of selling beans in the market and is requesting a loan to buy other items such as millet, maize flour, etc, to sell. Rakela is 35 years old and is married to a taxi driver. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and to build a house for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy other items such as millet, maize flour, etc., to sell

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is a 33-year-old married man living in Hasbayya, BInt Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and two children. He has been a car painter since 1998 and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to continue building his house. This is his first experience with microcredit. Najib hopes he can make his house comply with international health standards to keep his children and family members safe. He hopes to reach a time when he can rest and just take good care of his small family.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Minerva's Group

texts.en: Minerva G. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Minerva G.'s Group. Minerva is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. She is 29 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Minerva owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Minerva joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling palm oil

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Бердикулов Журабек проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Кроме того сними живут его радители. Сам Журабек более 7 лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает пшеницу. Кредит просит для закупа качественных семян, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Jurabek B. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife is a housewife. His parents also live with them. Jurabek has been in agriculture for more than seven years. He grows wheat. He is asking for a loan to buy quality seeds to sow good crops.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie J. is a businesswoman who makes a living selling provisions and other cooking items at the central market in her town, which is named Bo. She has been in this line of work for 20 years, while her husband makes a living as a tailor. They have eight children. Marie is applying for a loan to buy supplies in bulk from a wholesaler. She has an outstanding credit history and is a member of a loan group. She will use the increased income made possible by this loan to pay for the schooling of her children and complete work on her new store.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng O. is a 30-year-old fish seller and has been operating her own business in a market located in Siem Reap province. By doing this, she is able to earn a profit of at least $3 a day which she uses to support her family.

Leng O. is a good mother who takes care of two teenage children who attend the local public school. The family’s other contributor, Leng O.’s husband, age 32, earns money by fishing.

Leng O. needs the Kiva loan in order to enlarge her fish-selling trade because she hopes this will allow her to increase her income to ensure that her family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To enlarge her fish-selling business

loans.name: Ana Geissel

texts.es:
La joven Ana Geissel tiene la edad de 22 años, es casada y con una carga familiar de 3 hijos varones de los cuales dos de ellos esta en edad escolar, su esposo es trabajador del Ingenio san Antonio desde hace 3 años y es obrero.. 
Ella se dedica desde hace 12 años a la venta de tortillas en el mercado municipal, y desde el año 2008 se le han financiado 9 créditos para compra de Maíz, leña, cal.
texts.en:
Ana is 22 years old. She is married and has three sons, two of whom are of school age. Her husband has been working as a laborer in San Antonio for the past three years and she has been selling tortillas in the municipal market for the past 12 years. She’s had nine loans since 2008, which she has used to buy corn, firewood and salt.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase frozen foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: La señora Janeth V. R., labora,tiene 37 añoes de edad es madre soltera labora como conserge en la UNIVERSIDAD CATOLICA DE NICARAGUA me siento agradecida con el financiamiento que CEPRODEL me ha otorgado y el tiempo en que me lo tramitaron ya que era de urgencia , para comprar algunas laminas de cin para mi vivienda ya que esta en mal estado y ya viene el invierno y no quiero mojatrme.
texts.en:
La señora Janeth V. R., labora,tiene 37 añoes de edad es madre soltera labora como conserge en la UNIVERSIDAD CATOLICA DE NICARAGUA me siento agradecida con el financiamiento que CEPRODEL me ha otorgado y el tiempo en que me lo tramitaron ya que era de urgencia , para comprar algunas laminas de cin para mi vivienda ya que esta en mal estado y ya viene el invierno y no quiero mojatrme.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mejoras de vivienda

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Plata Group

texts.es:
Maria M. C. de 26 años es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Vicuñitas de Plata, ella se dedica a vender queso  desde hace 2 años, en la Ceja y la feria 16 de Julio y necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería. Las demás integrantes tienen variados negocios como:  elaboración de calzados, tejido de chompas,  venta de comida (chicharron) venta de caramelos y confección de faldas.
Liderizadas por su mesa directiva elaboran su reglamento interno,  ellas se reúnen en el Centro Focal German Busch.
texts.en:
Maria M. C. is 26 years old and a member of the Vicuna Community Association of Plata. She has worked selling cheese for the past 2 years in Ceja and the July 16th market; she needs this loan to buy more inventory. The other group members work in various businesses like: making shoes, weaving sweaters, selling food (chicharron), selling candy and making dresses. They are led by their board of directors who comes up with their bylaws; they meet in the German Busch Center.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 24 year-old "boda boda" driver. He provides transport services on his motorbike along the Nairobi Highway between Thika and Niarobi. He carries many kind of passengers: men, women, and children. He has been in this business for 2 years. The primary challenges that he faces are the high cost of maintenance and providing spare parts for his motorbike.  Before becoming a boda boda driver, Joel sold items at a kiosk that he owned.

Joel plans to use his 20,000 KES loan to purchase a more modern motorbike so that he can expand his business. In the future, Joel hopes to "graduate" from the motorbike transport business to a taxi business with a car. In 5 years, he sees himself as a successful businessman with a fleet of cars on the road.

Joel describes himself as hard-working, able to work long hours, and a good investor of the the little money that he has.

loans.use: To buy a more modern motorbike to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and two young children. In 1998, he opened his own grocery store, which was then expanded to include chocolate making.

He is now requesting to borrow $2,000 to increase his purchases for the upcoming summer season.

loans.use: to increase his purchases

loans.name: Ma. Clarence

texts.en:
Ma. Clarence B. is from the village of P-Jasmin, Iligan City. She is 37 years old. Ma. Clarence is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Clarence owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling eggs and also making home-made peanut butter  products to sell in the local community. Ma. Clarence has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Clarence joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Clarence has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Clarence is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: P-Jasmin, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz lives with her family in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children, who are getting their education. It is very difficult to afford the education expenses of the children, and that’s why Kaniz started a bangles sales business last year with the help of an Asasah loan.

Her husband has a billiard and video games shop. His shop is always busy with the presence of children. Children are the main clients of his shop. 
Kaniz has applied for a loan for the second time from Asasah for her husband’s business expansion. With the loan amount, he will buy another billiard table and video games for his game shop.

She is hopeful that this investment will increase her husband’s income sufficiently and she will be able to provide the basic necessities of life for her children.

This is a group loan.

Note: Kaniz shows her bangles in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase games for game shop.

loans.name: Ngveang

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngveang T. sells fresh fish in the market to earn a living. Every day in the late morning, she goes to a place where fishermen sell fish in bulk. Then she hurries to bring the fish to the market, where she sells them retail. Ngveang T. has another financial earner in her husband who appears in the photograph here. He works in the construction sector. The couple has two teenage children who work as hairdressers.

Ngveang T. runs her business well because she sells at reasonable prices and has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. Recently, Ngveang T. received orders for lots of fish from her regular customers, but she lacks the capital to better meet her customers' requirements. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To provide more capital to better meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and well known for its history and the hospitality of its people. Irshad is 53 years old and cannot work at this old age, but stays at home and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife well. She has given birth to two daughters and two sons. Both sons left their education after completing 10th standard because their family needed their financial support. Both have a motor workshop where they repair, specifically, motorbikes. Her elder daughter got her education up to the 14th standard and teaches in a private school as a teacher. Her youngest daughter is studying in the 10th standard. 

Irshad's husband has a construction supplies business, but at the old age of 60 he can’t work full-time. Irshad has applied for a loan from Asasah for her sons who want to start a motorbike spare-parts sales business. With the loan amount, they will buy spare parts for motorbikes which they will sell from their motor workshop. They have been running their motor workshop for over five years and Irshad is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for their business. This is the 1st time that Irshad has applied for a loan to any MFI and she hopes that it will be a long term relationship between her and Asasah.

loans.use: To purchase motorbikes spare-parts for selling.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 48 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector more specifically, in fish vending. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie L. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Melanie is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Melanie makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products like pancit guisado (meat, seafood and noodles) in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Liliash

texts.en: Liliash B. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell.  Liliash is 46 years old and is widowed. She has five children and currently only two of her children are in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Claudia Benita

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia Benita F. M. es originaria del municipio Telica comarca el Ji carito, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para compra de electro domestico. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de, electro domestico. Con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Esta señora tiene 1 hijos a su cargo.
texts.en: Claudia Benita F. M. is originally from the Hamlet of Ji Carito, in the town of Teloca.  She currently works as an elementary school teacher in Santa Rosa del Peñón, where she has worked for six years.  This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and she will use the money to buy a domestic appliance so that she can improve her family’s quality of life. She has one son whom she cares for.

loans.use: Home appliance

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel M. is from the city of Dalapang Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old. Richel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Richel owns & operates a business planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale like squash in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Richel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Richel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 50 years old, married and has 2 children aged 22 and 16. Lucia owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lucia also raises pigs and chickens.

Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Roca Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Roca está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Elba Tamara S. Ortiz de 23 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y perfumes la cual inicio con 1,000 córdobas  hace tres años y poco a poco y gracias a los préstamos y su ardua labor ha ido mejorando su negocio. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en ropa, zapatos y perfumes para mejorar su negocio.
S. tiene un pequeño de 10 años y su sueño es tener su casa propia.
Las otras integrantes son Gloria Elena Calero quien realiza tortillas desde hace tres años y Velma B. quien tiene una pequeña venta y ropa desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The La Roca (The Rock) group is composed of three hard working women.  One of them is Elba Tamara S. Ortiz, 23.  She sells clothes and perfumes.  She started out with 1,000 córdobas three years ago and gradually, thanks to loans and her hard work, has been improving the business.

She will use the loan to buy clothes, shoes and perfumes to improve the business.

Silvia has a 10 year old son and her dream is to have her own house.

The other group members are: Gloria Elena Calero who has made tortillas for the last three years and Velma B. who has had a small sales business and clothes for the last five years.

loans.use: For clothes, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
la sra. Sayda A. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Cedrito en el Triunfo, Choluteca.
Sayda se dedica a la fabricacion de coronas para adornar. Sayda es madre de 4 hijos y los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. Junto con su esposo trabajan duro para mantener a sus hijos.
Sayda tambien se dedica a la cria de gallinas y cerdos, pero su fuerte son las ventas de las coronas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las coronas.
su meta es darles un buen estudio a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sayda A. is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood Cedrito in El Triunfo, Choluteca. Sayda makes crowns for decorations. She is the mother of four children and she has them attend the  town's school. She and her husband work hard to support their children. 

Sayda also raises chickens and pigs but her strength is in the sales of the crowns. She will use this loan to buy materials to make the crowns. Her goal is to provide her children with a good education so that they can be good professionals.

loans.use: Purchase glue, paper in different colors, wire, bags and thread.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Hace 10 años José Ramón que tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de triciclo y una pulpería. Ha buscado la forma de salir adelante con su negocio, Fue entonces cuando en su afán de salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos, decidió empezar a este medio de vida. Su negocio ha crecido de manera considerable, teniendo la fortuna de conseguir nuevos clientes es por ello precisamente, que requiere de un crédito para realizarle mejoras  a su triciclo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: For 10 years José Ramón has had his business offering a bike service and running a convenience store. He has been looking for a way to get ahead with his business, and from his desire to get ahead and make his own income he decided to start this style of life. His business has grown considerably, and he has had the good luck to get new customers.
