For this reason, he needs a loan to make improvements to his bike in order to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos C. A. tiene 20 años de edad. Es soltero Vive con el papá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Juan Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder terminar su carrera.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos C. A. is 20. He is single and lives with his father in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has no children.

The members of the V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre ["November 26th"] are located in the Las Blancas neighbourhood belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Juan Carlos has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for five years. He buys his products in Agripac and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to be able to finish his degree.
He likes sports.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy E., 46, is a widow with one son and five daughters. Three of her children are garment factory workers, one is learning tailoring skills and the other two are in school. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Channy runs a grocery store at home. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es:
Bertha es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de ropa, zapato, habiendo establecido su negocio hace doce años, con pequeñas compras de mercadería, ahora aumentando sus ventas gracias a los préstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado en dos ciclos.
Parte de su mercadería la compra en un mercado a proveedores en donde las adquiere a mejor precio, para dar precios accesibles a sus clientes.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara uniformes para damas y caballeros, calcetas, zapatos, que es lo que mas esta siendo demandado por el curso de año entrante. Lo que está contenta por apoyar a su familia con los gastos ya que también tiene los gastos de sus tres hijos que cursan sus estudios.
texts.en:
Bertha is a small businesswoman who sells clothing and shoes. She started her business twelve years ago by making small purchases of merchandise. Now she has increased her sales as a result of the funding she has received from AFODENIC for the past two loan cycles.

Bertha acquires part of her merchandise from the suppliers market where she can get the best price, which enables her to pass on the savings to her customers. With this new loan she will buy uniforms for women and men, socks, and shoes since these items are more in demand for the upcoming year. Bertha is happy to be supporting her family with the expenses as well as the cost of sending her three children to school.

loans.use: Purchase uniforms, socks, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Mrs. Khan T., 61, has been married since 1976 and has 8 children  – 6 sons and 2 daughters. Four are married, two are garment factory workers, one assists his parents in the business, and another one is in school. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Khan and her husband are lotus farmers. They want to start a new business raising fish to generate more income to better support their family. Hence Khan is asking for her first loan of $1,000.  She will also use a part of the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her lotus farm.

loans.use: To start fish raising business and maintain lotus farm

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son N. is 46 years of age and is a resident of Phnom Penh City. She is a housewife who manages household work such as caring for children, cooking delicious foods, managing cash flow, and conducting other duties in and around her house. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a former construction worker and is making an average profit of $3 a day. They have given birth to three children. Two of their children are single and employed in variety jobs while one is married. 

Son N. is taking out her loan to buy a motorcycle which will be used by her daughter to ride to her work place. She hopes to use the remainder of the funds to buy some construction material for repairing her old house. Son N. and her granddaughter are show in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle which will be used by her daughter to ride to her work place.

loans.name: Meakra

texts.en:
Mrs. Meakra P. (pictured with her daughter) is 30 years old. She has been married to her husband, Mr. Yee Yen (26 years old), since 2005. They have one young daughter. They live in a village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Meakra and her husband are rice farmers. Mr. Yee Yen is also a lathe operator. Meakra hopes to supplement her family's income by starting a new business selling groceries when she is not at the farm. So, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 34-year-old married man.  He has two school-going children, aged 3 and 10.  He has been operating a tailoring business for five years.  He also works as an auctioneer.  He was previously practicing pig farming to earn a living.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he opened a savings account.   This has helped him to manage his finances.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to add to his stock of fabrics.

loans.use: To add to his stock of fabrics.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba N. sells banku in Eguafo Village, near the fishing town Elmina. Banku is a favourite Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough and cassava dough. It is usually served with fish stew, soup or pepper sauce. She also sells clothes to make some extra income. Aba has been in this trade for 15 years. 

Aba’s husband is a security guard and they have six children. Her income goes a long way in paying for their children’s school fees and some household expenses. 

Aba plans to use the loan to purchase more maize, fish, tomatoes and other food ingredients to grow her food business. She also intends to purchase more clothes for sale. Focused on long-term growth, her additional profits will be reinvested back into her business.

In this picture Aba is showing the corn dough she uses for the banku.

loans.use: to buy maize, fish, tomatoes and other food ingredients

loans.name: Jesilly

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Jesilly works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport (habal-habal) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing. Jesilly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy an additional motorcycle for her transport (habal-habal) business.

Jesilly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios, who is 56. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with children who have already established their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedios operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5-Philippines-pesos (Php) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Remedios earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also incorporates into her store a mineral-water refilling area while managing their rag-making business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also purchase additional raw materials needed for her rag-making business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her businesses. 

Remedios hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house renovated before the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cases of beverages and mineral water for her variety store and for additional raw materials needed for her rag-making business.

loans.name: Trabajando Por El Futuro Group

texts.es: Ada participa en la Alcancía Comunal “Trabajando por el Futuro”  donde ejerce el cargo de secretaria. Ada es conviviente y a sus 40 años tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Ada se dedica hace 1 año al negocio de la venta de pasteles, budines, leche asada, entre otros postres, ella lo distribuye atraves de sus vecinos de su comunidad, familiares, colegios. Ada nos cuenta que estudió repostería  y que gracias a ello pudo empezar su pequeño negocio, ella es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora que ha podido surgir y esta logrando  ayudar a sus menores hijos en su educación.  El deseo de Ada  es de techar su  casa para así poner un puesto donde mostrar sus productos. Con el reciente préstamo  Ada piensa  comprar más insumos  para su pequeño negocio como azúcar, leche, harina, huevos, etc. En la Alcancía Comunal “Trabajando por el Futuro” están agradecidos por el préstamo recibido y en esta segunda oportunidad están recibiendo a nuevos integrantes que son responsables y emprendedores. Todos asistieron a las instalaciones de Edaprospo- prosperidad incluso con sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Ada is a member of the Communal Bank “Trabajando por el Futuro” (Working for the Future), where she serves as the group secretary. She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children who are dependent on her. For the past year, Ada has managed a business in which she sells pastries, puddings, flans, and other desserts. She distributes her products to neighbors, relatives, and schools in her community. Ada says she studied pastry making and used her knowledge to start her small business. She is an earnest and hardworking woman who has been able to get ahead and help her young children with their education. Ada wants to put a roof on her house so that she can open a store where she can display her products. With this new loan, Ada plans to buy more supplies for her small business such as sugar, milk, flour, eggs, and other products.

The Communal Bank “Trabajando por el Futuro” is grateful for the loan that has been received. During this second loan cycle, the group received new members who are responsible and enterprising. All of the members, including their children, have taken advantage of the facilities provided by EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, flour, eggs, and other products for making desserts.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 31ans, Ayawavi est secrétaire. Elle a une petite boutique dans laquelle elle fait des photocopies, des impressions et des saisies de texte à ceux qui n’ont pas de matériels à la maison. Elle n’a pas eu de difficultés à payer ses anciens prêts vue qu’elle est à son quatrième. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des matériels informatiques
texts.en: A 31-year-old young woman, Ayawavi is a secretary who has a small shop in which she offers photocopies, printing, and word-processing for people without home equipment. She has not had problems repaying her previous loans, given that she is now on her fourth loan. She is requesting this loan to buy computer supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies and equipment

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 22 years old, married and has two children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Kasubi in the central Kampala region of Uganda. For two years Evelyn has had a small shop where she sells sugar. She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.

To help expand her business, Evelyn has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar for resale. Evelyn is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which will help her prospects for the future.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Evelyn hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself like buying new clothes. In the future, Evelyn hopes to work hard to create a bigger shop. She wants to buy a plot of land for herself.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for resale.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan is 38 years old. She lives in Dong Thon village. She is married with two children. She has a store in the market. She has had this job for 10 years. She has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). This is the first time she has participated in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy goods to sell. She is the leader of a 5-member group loan.
 
About other borrowers in her group.
 Huan is 39 years old. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy more clothes.
 Sau is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 Hau is 56 years old. She wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy bamboo.
 Hang is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to repair her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and has five children. 

Adel has had an auto repair shop since 2004. He has a lot of experience, a deep understanding of local consumers, and is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $2100 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He aims to make more money to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “United” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are small businessmen who have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aruna. Aruna was born in the northern township of Magburaka, about 26 years ago. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a nurse and his children are still not of school-going age. Aruna has been running a telephone/mobile phone booth for the past 5 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy top-up cards for all four mobile networks for resale, to buy chargers, etc.

loans.use: to buy top-up cards for all four mobile networks for resale, to buy chargers, etc.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with one boy who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 11 years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other food vendors in the area. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 60,000 she wants to establish a food stall business, purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a food stall business, purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en: Silva is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. She is from Lebanon. She has been working since 2006 in selling filters to refine water. She works from her home. With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to purchase additional filters to sell. She intends to increase her business sales in order to help her husband with the household expenses. In the future, she is planning to open her own water refining station.

loans.use: to purchase additional filters to sell

loans.name: Nimia Eliceth

texts.es:
La señora Nimia tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la comunidad El Caimito de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ahi vive con sus cuatro hijos, Nimia es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulpieria ubicada en su casa de habitacion. Nimia a luchado sola para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Sus clientes son los vecinos de la comunidad su negocio abre de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia is 43 years old and resides in the community of El Caimito in the city of San Lorenzo.  She lives with her four children.  Nimia is a single mother and sells popular consumer products.  She has a store located in her home.  Working alone, Nimia strives to move forward on behalf of her children.  Her customers consist of neighbors from the community.  She is open for business Monday through Sunday.  
	
This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and works hard to support her family. For the past 16 years, she has operated a cheese-making business in the Philippines.

Gloria is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients to make and sell cheese. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Enoque

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e tem 4 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas de casa. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane aprocura de melhores condicoes de vida, trabalha como electrecista auto na Super Steel ha mais de 2 anos , e tem um salario de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca solicitou emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 30.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (ferro, areia, barrotes, chapas e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, também  para a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, mais tarde construir uma mercearia  para a sua esposa, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Enoque was born in the district of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. He went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother financially, sending her money to help with her expenses.

He left Chibuto for Boane in search of a better life. He's worked as an auto electrician at Super Steel for more than two years and earns a salary of 12,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account (BIM).
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fifth loan, in the amount of 30,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, rebar, sheet metal, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 10,000, 12,000, and 15,000, and 20,000 meticals, were all also used for his home.
He hopes to finish the house to offer his family a more comfortable life. In the future he would like to build a grocery store for his wife, for which he will request further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, rebar, sheet metal, etc.).

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: José De Jesús es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su oficio que le costo años para recibir su titulo pues el es Veterinario de profesión desde hace como 40 años, por lo que opto en instalar su propio negocio donde el pudiera desempeñar lo que estudio y servir a la comunidad y animales en general. La veterinaria ya tiene 31 años ofreciendo el mejor servicio, en el que vende medicinas, animales, consultas medicas y cortes de cabello a los animales.  Para José es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que por una largo tiempo ha sido su fuente de ingresos para el y su familia por lo que desea comprar mercancía como medicinas, animales de diferentes razas, y otros accesorios para sus consultas medicas. De esta manera el seguirá ofreciendo a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: José De Jesús is a very hardworking man, who has been dedicated to his profession. He spent years training to become a vet, and has been in the profession for approximately 40 years now. He decided to start his own clinic, where he could put his experties to good use in serving the community and animals in general. He has been offering an excellent service for 31 years, selling medicines and pets as well as medical consultations and cuting animals' hair. For José it is very important to keep the business going because for a long time it has been his family's source of income. He would like to buy merchandise such as medicines, different types of animals, and other accessories for his medical consultations. In this way he will continue to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, including medicines and other things for his business.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María vive con tres hijos, tiene una venta de tamales y frescos, tiene experiencia en el negocio ya que lo realiza hace tres años, lo aprendió por su propia iniciativa y trabaja todos los días a tiempo completo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como maiz, aceite, pollo,para el negocio y también abono para la milpa, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y su producción agropecuaria así también los ingresos económicos en su hogar.
Su mayor sueño es trabajar para mantener a su familia y mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
María lives with her three children. She sells tamales and fruit drinks.  She has experience in the business, as she has been doing it for three years. She learned it on her own initiative, and works full-time every day. 

She is applying for a loan to buy merchandise such as corn, cooking oil, and chicken for the business, and also fertilizers for her cornfield. This purchase will help her improve her business, her farming production, as well as her household income. 

Her greatest dream is to work to support her family, and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: To buy corn, cooking oil, and chicken for making tamales, and fertilizer for her cornfield.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité "La Esperanza" tiene 10 integrantes, todas ellas mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Ellas han demostrado unión y solidaridad las unas con las otras. Todas son de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi, son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad.
Una de ellas es la señora Otilia, quien se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser cerdos y gallinas. Por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo ha logrado mantener a su familia y cuidar del hogar, por lo que no se cansa de luchar. Comenta que tiene buena venta de sus animales, por lo que le gustaría seguir trabajando en el.
Por ello solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de cerdos pequeños, para la cría y posterior venta. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva también por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza" [Hope] committee has ten members, all very hard-working, industrious women. They have shown their union and solidarity with each other. All of them are from the city of Villa Ygatimi; they are neighbors and friends from that city.

One of them is Otilia, who earns a living raising and selling farm animals, such as pigs and chickens. Through her work and efforts, she has been able to support her family and take care of her home; because of this, she never gets tired of working to get ahead. She says that sales of her animals are good, so she would like to continue this work.

Because of this, she is asking for the help of the foundation and Kiva to purchase young pigs to raise and then sell. She thanks the foundation and also Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: purchase young pigs to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Ndusya

texts.en: Ndusya is married and blessed with five children, who are in school. She runs a retail shop business  to support her family. She has been in business for the last five years. She also does farming to supplement her income. Her potential customers are the local residents. Ndusya is requesting a loan of 62,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jascar

texts.en:
Jascar, aged 29 years-old, is married to Geoffrey and they are blessed with one 12 year-old child. She runs a grocery stall that has been in operation for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes.12,000.

This is her first loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  She will use the funds to buy groceries such as onions, carrots, cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

Jascar hopes to educate her child and open another grocery in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Thu has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to raise such as sugar, salt,... to sell.

Thu is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 05.08.47Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2010, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thu has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to raise such as sugar, salt,... to sell.

loans.name: Iane Ixara

texts.en:
Iane Ixara is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single, with 2 children. 
Iane Ixara has a shop that sells beauty & personal hygiene products from AVON. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from AVON to sell.
Iane Ixara has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Iane Ixara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON to sell

loans.name: Nezerwa Group

texts.en:
Verene is a group leader, aged 44 years. She is married with six children aged between 6 and 21 years. They all go to school. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in business for eight years.

With the loan, she would like to buy bananas, cassava, and Irish potatoes to sell. The group is called Nezerwa which means “To rejoice” in English. They sell different produce and they wish to expand their businesses so as to have a better future.

loans.use: To buy bananas, cassava, and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Nora Hilda

texts.en:
Nora Hilda is 49 years old. She lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas. She is married and a mother of two children. Two years ago, with the support of one of her friends, she began selling shoes and later clothes to support her family and cover household expenses but mainly to give her children a better standard of living and the security to help them finish their professional studies. She continues with her business thanks to her effort and the support of her family.

Nora needs a loan of $375 USD to buy merchandise (jeans, sweaters, sport pants). Since the Christmas season is coming the number of orders will increase. Be part of the success of Nora and her family, support her!

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lerch:

Nora Hilda tiene 49 años D. edad, vive en la localidad D. Tampico, Tamaulipas, es casada y madre D. dos hijos. Hace dos años ella decidió, con la ayuda D. una amiga, comenzar a vender zapatos y tiempo después ropa, con el objetivo D. hacer frente a los fuertes gastos D. su hogar, pero sobretodo con el fin D. darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida y la seguridad D. ayudarles a terminar sus estudios profesionales. Ahora Nora continua con su negocio gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo e impulsada con el apoyo D. su familia.

Nora requiere un préstamo D. $375 dlls. para comprar mercancía ( pantalones, chamarras, pants deportivos), pues la temporada naviD.ña se acerca y los pedidos aumentan. Sé parte D. los logros D. Nora y su familia, apóyala.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Wambui Mworia intends to buy 20 bales of materials

loans.name: King

texts.en:
Mr. T. is 40 years old, married, and the father of three children. He has been in rice agriculture for 10 years. His wife sells kitchenware. Mr. T. received his middle school diploma and was also trained in rice agriculture. He is currently the technical specialist in rice agriculture that assists the other farmers in his solidarity group with their fields. He began working in agriculture by helping his parents, first by raising pigs, and then with rice. He was able to plant his first plot on rented land with a loan from his father, but this year he did not have the necessary funds to plant, and therefore had to leave his plot empty until the next harvest.

The loan and his income will allow Mr. T. to better care for his children’s education, both are currently in school. He will also eventually be able to improve his family’s home and health. While he is able to properly feed his family, Mr. T. cannot afford the hospital fees or medicine when they become ill. He hopes to one day be able to build a house on a plot of land that he currently owns because since they are now living in his mother’s house.

loans.use: Mr. Tonou is asking for a $1,200 loan (plus $800 from Microfund Togo) in order to help him cultivate rice and pay his rent for the land.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana is a married woman with one daughter. Her husband works as a truck driver. Two years ago, however, he was unemployed. For a while, Maria Juana did domestic work for the mother of one of the town's teachers; after that, she began her own business. Over time she acquired better customers, which caused her sales to increase. Currently, she has a list of steady customers and hopes to continue to expand her business.

Maria Juana is requesting a $200 loan to purchase merchandise for her business so that she can increase the volume of her sales. She is committed to repaying the loan in three months. Maria Juana and her family would be grateful for your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

María Juana es una mujer casada y tiene una hija, su esposo trabaja como chofer de camión actualmente, hace dos años él estaba desempleado y fue en esa época en la que María Juana se encontraba trabajando como empleada doméstica en casa de la mamá de uno de los maestros del pueblo, quien la invitó a que se dedicara a la venta de sus productos y fue en ese entonces cuando ella empezó con su negocio propio. Poco a poco fue teniendo mayor clientela y por ende sus ventas comenzaron a mejorar, ahora ya tiene una cartera de clientes fijos quienes le solicitan de sus productos y ella desea continuar con el crecimiento de sus ventas.

María Juana está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $200 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así poder incrementar el volumen de sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Argentina Víctor

texts.pt:
Arrgentina Víctor Z. if 42 years old, and a single mother of two children. She lives in the Magoanine district in Maputo. She sells used clothes at her home. She started this businesses two hyears ago. She entered the program in March 2007 with a loan of 6000 meticais that was repaid punctually. She will start her 2nd loan cycle and will take out 8000 meticais to pay in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Arrgentina Víctor Z. tem 42 anos de idade, é mãe solteira de dois filhos. Vive no bairro Magoanine em Maputo. Vende roupa usada na sua residência, negócio que começou já a dois anos. Entrou para o programa em Março de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT que foi pontualmente reembolsado. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 6 Meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
For the past six years Annet N. has owned the Annet Unisex Hair Salon. She is married with 3 children and she cares for 5 dependents. She is new to her lending group and this is her first loan. With her loan she plans to buy braids, weaves and chemicals for her salon. A large majority of women use braids and weaves in widely varying styles. Although her clients have little money, they still find it important to tend to their hygiene and appearance.  
Annet dreams of one day buying a plot of land and building a home. This is a dream of a lot of people in the villages of Uganda. They do not want to leave their village, but they hope one day not to have to rent. Often a plot is small and a house is one or two rooms made of adobe brick.

loans.use: Annet plans to use her loan to buy more braids, weaves and chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is a 32 year old man.  He lives in South Lebanon in the region of Saida. This is the third time Ashraf is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He usually uses it to buy merchandise for his grocery shop. This time, he will also be using the loan to purchase merchandise.  It is the holiday season and that he will need more provisions for the occasion.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery shop

loans.name: Sultonova

texts.en: Sultonova S. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has a child. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  She has recommended herself as a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She trades in the bazaar where her trade outlet is located. She is engaged in the special material for the national dress making  and selling. She is very experienced in business. Prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices and she has a wide assortment. That is why she works with the clients of  different income levels. Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity she has repeat customers. . Working in the  bazaar she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. It would permit her to realize her new business plans and to develop the existing business. Now Mrs. Sultonova requests a loan of $300.

loans.use: to develop the existing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a fish-selling store in their home.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en: This young man is single. He was born in 1983. Mayis has sold phone accessories for 2 years. He lives in the town of Khachmaz. He needs a loan of $950 to buy phone accessories for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is a woman who is very committed to the development of her home. On a daily basis, she dedicates herself to providing service from her shop in addition to working as the municipal councilor of her community. Her knowledge and good management have been the contributing factors to her becoming a female leader in her community. She works with her family in the countrysiD. and also tends to her cows in her stable. She wishes to proviD. better service in her store and acquire a greater quantity of products for the benefit of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Bertha, es una mujer muy comprometida con el desarrollo D. su espacio habitacional y familiar, se dedica a diario a brindar servicios en su tienda y también a desempeñar el cargo D. regidora en su comunidad. Sus conocimientos y buena administración han sido factores preponderantes para convertirse en una mujer líder D. su localidad.Trabaja con su familia en el campo y también atienD. a sus vaquitas en su establo. Desea brindar un mejor servicio en su bodega y adquirir mayor cantidad D. productos para beneficio D. sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremental capital to acquire a greater quantity of raw materials.

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en: Abdul Sabor lives in district 5 of Kabul Afghanistan. Hhe is educated and married. He is a carpenter with a small shop and lots of clients. Abdul wants to enlarge his shop, so he is requesting loan to buy the necessary materials. This will enable him to provide for more customers and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand his carpentry shop

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores started her business because she has always liked to cook and her family would always tell her that she has a knack for it. She realized that cooking is a good business. Since she needed to earn extra money without leaving the home or neglecting her family, she decided to sell food approximately 10 years ago. She initially opened only and Saturdays and Sundays, but her customers asked her to open everyday, so she did.

She is requesting a loan of $250.00 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months, in order to remodel her kitchen and business space so that it will be more appealing and she can offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María Dolores inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado cocinar y sus familiares siempre le decían que tenia muy buen sazón y descubrió que era buen negocio. Ella necesitaba ofrecer otro ingreso a su familia y con la comodidad de no salir de casa y no desatender a mi familia. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 10 años vendiendo solo sábado y domingo, pero la misma gente le pedía que vendiera todos los días y así es ahora.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses, el cual le ayudara a arreglar la cocina y el local y esto dará mejor aspecto al negocio, y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes.

loans.use: Kitchen remodeling

loans.name: Chhup

texts.en: Chhup P., 52, lives in Siem Reap with three of her children. She goes out to her field each day and grows vegetables and rice to sell in the local food market. Typically she makes US$1.50 each day, but she is also supported by her son who works in construction. The other two children are students in the local schools and are dependent upon the family's income. Inflation has made it difficult for many Cambodians to support their families this past year, and many are forced to look for ways to increase their income. Chhup P. has asked for a loan of US$1200 to purchase a cow to help her plow her farmland. The land needs to be plowed each year, and this investment can help cut down on some expenses. She looks forward to the opportunities that this loan provides and looks forward to the results.

loans.use: Purchase cow to help plow

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 48 years old. She is married and she has 9 children. She became a tailor in 1987. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 8 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $145 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items fro her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase haircare products to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through Junior High Level. Grace sells artificial hair pieces, panties, shoes and others products and she has also operated a beauty salon at Kwesidukrom near Elmina 2005. 

Grace uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. She will use the loan of $700 to purchase more hair products and other goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to complete her building, which she started and had to stop.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to purchase more hair products and other goods for sale.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 38-year-old man. He lives in small village near Nabatieh with his wife and 4 children. He owns a small shop for selling housewares such as plastic storage containers, utensils, and baking sheets. Abbas wants to purchase a more diverse array of products and has requested a $1000 loan from Al Majmoua for this purpose. This will be Abbas’s first loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Abbas will use the loan to purchase new types of products for his housewares shop

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Хасанова Соджида проживает в районе Гиссар. Живет не далеко от центра . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей одежды уже 17 лет. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Торговая точка находится на центральном рынке района. МЕсто арендованное и она платит арендную плату ежемесячно. Сейчас планирует получить кредит для ого, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sojida H. lives in the Gissar district, not far from the center. She is married and has four children. For the past 17 years she has been selling clothing. The goods are brought in from the city of Dushanbe. Her sales stall is in the district's central market. She rents the stall for a monthly fee. Now she plans to use a loan to increase sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis tiene    27 años, vive en pareja con  Luján que tiene 25 años. Conviven juntos hace 5 años y no tienen hijos aún. Ya poseen casa propia que han logrado adquirir con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Derlis posee un negocio de venta de calzados en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Itá. El negocio funciona hace 8 años. Su compañera es docente y ejerce en dos escuelas, una privada y otra pública.
Derlis desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio, anteriormente realizaba sus ventas en forma ambulante, luego gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar un pequeño puesto en el mercado municipal y fue surtiéndolo de a poco.
Actualmente el negocio de Derlis está muy bien surtido con calzados de todo tipo como ser: zapatos de vestir para damas y caballeros, calzados deportivos y zapatillas.

Sus ventas han ido aumentando considerablemente con el transcurrir de los años y ha formado una muy buena clientela en todo este tiempo.
No se queja de su suerte y afirma que el negocio le rinde muy buenas ganancias. Con el apoyo incondicional de su compañera ha logrado salir adelante.
En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías debido a que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y desea adquirir mayor variedad de calzados para damas y caballeros así como también calzados deportivos y zapatillas.
texts.en:
Derlis is 27 years old and lives with his couple Lujan who is 25 years old. They live together for 5 years now and have no kids yet. They have their own house which was acquired with effort and hard work. Derlis works selling shoes at the municipal market in the city of Ita for the past 8 years. His couple is a teacher and she works in two schools, one private and one public school. Derlis started working on sales very young, he used to sell things on the street, later with his hard work, he was able to buy a spot in the municipal market and kept on supplying it. Currently his business has very good inventory with dress shoes for ladies and gentlemen, sport shoes, and sandals. His sales have increased with time as well as his clients during all these years. He can't complain on his good luck and the business is profitable. And with his couple's support he has been able to succeed. Right now he needs a loan to buy more merchandise because of the year end holidays and to diversify his stock of ladies and gentleman's shoes, as well as sport shoes and sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ladies and gentleman's shoes, sport shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim T. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocery seller, selling cooked ingredients out of her house. She is 54 years old and has three children, two of whom are married and are living in the family home, while another one is single. Her husband is Nhep Phat, who grows different kinds of vegetables like cabbages and morning glories, which he will sell to a market-seller in 3 months after he begins planting them.

Phat is facing difficulty with watering his vegetable crop, so he and his wife decided to ask for a loan to purchase a pump to pump water for their vegetable crop. The family lives in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to pump water for vegetable crop

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: La dame Mariétou B. est une veuve avec 7 enfants en charges. Elle va s’adonner au commerce de pommes de terre, d’oignons et de divers produits alimentaires. Elle compte améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille avec les revenus générés par son activité mais aussi faire face à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariétou B. is a widow with seven children to support. She is going to devote all her time to commerce in potatoes, onions, and various foods items. She intends to improve her family’s living conditions with the revenues generated from her work but also to address her children’s schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling potatoes, onion, etc.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi sells tubers of yam to her customers. She hopes to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah K. is currently in the business of selling cassava flour and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Deborah is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business selling cassava flour

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a native of Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She has three children. Since her husband is dead she has raised her children alone. Her main source of income comes from her sari-sari (grocery) store.

She's now on her 3rd loan cycle with a request for PHP 5,000 for the purchase of additional stock for her grocery store. She needs to buy other items that are not yet displayed but which are always asked for by her loyal customers. Aside from the income from her groceries, she is also involved in selling bananas.

She is always hoping that her business will grow big, so that she can send all her children to a college education. It is also her utmost desire to have a decent home someday.

She said that, for her, it is really a great privilege that she has become one of the members of Paglaum because of its various programs and services that she has already availed herself of.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es: El comercio informal es la principal actividad de la asociación “Vicuñitas”, se dedican a la venta de leche, Feliza vende Chinelas y pantuflas, otras venden papa, y también venden almuerzos. Esta asociación trabaja hace más de dos años junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer. Se reunen quincenalmente en el centro focal Los Andes, a la fecha el grupo esta integrado por 16 miembros. Ahora ellas quieren reforzar sus negocios comprando mayor cantidad de mercadería, tienen la seguridad que obtendrán mayores ganancias para poder cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Informal commerce is the main activity of the group "Vicuñitas". Some members make a living selling milk. Feliza sells flip-flops and slippers. Others sell potatoes, while others sells lunches. The group has been with Kiva partner Pro-Mujer for more than two years. They meet every two weeks at the Andes focal center; at the moment the group consists of the 16 members. Now the women want to reinforce their businesses by purchasing larger quantities of merchandise and have the security to obtain more earnings to be able to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en: Safia S. is 28 years old. She is a divorced mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. Her kids are currently pursuing education at the primary school level. She lives with them in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community called Kofiase, suburb of Dorma the district capital. She trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital, and sells in the local market on a tabletop. She also treks to other towns to sell and uses the strategy of door-to-door selling. Safia has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk. She is expecting to receive higher profit with the loan and hopes that she would make more savings to support her kids education.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is 19 years old and blessed with three children. She is married to Roque D., a plaser (a gold miner using the traditional system of mining). She sells vegetables and bananas.

Julieta is a hardworking mother. Everyday, she peddles her vegetables and bananas in her neighborhood and nearby villages. Unfortunately, the income is not sufficient to provide for the needs of her family. She wants to expand her business by adding some varieties of vegetables. She is planning to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 5, 000. This will give her a higher income and help fulfill the demands of the customers. With this, she can give the family a good and comfortable living. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her application.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and bananas

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Аликулова Парвина проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 22 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Парвина вместе с мужем занимается торговлей. Она торгует видеодисками, этим видом бизнеса занимается более 13 лет. Клиентка просит кредит, увеличить товараоборот, т.е. закуп новых видеодисков.
texts.en:
Parvina A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 22 years old, married and has 2 children. Parvina and her husband are involved in sales. She sells video disks and has been involved in this business for over 13 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. purchase of new video disks.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
There are four low-income people who have decided to seek a loan for different purposes. One of these people, Mrs. Kong S., 46, has been chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. Kong S. currently works cleaning rooms for a small firm. She gets a specific salary of $70 a month to manage her family’s needs. She is married with one teenage child who is still unemployed, while her husband works in construction. Kong S. currently faces difficulties with water system use; she always buys water for her own family's use at an expensive price from her neighbors. She hopes to reduce this cost by using a loan to pay for connecting a new water system. The other three borrowers are: Mr. Uk S., a security guard, who is asking for a loan to pay for connecting a watering system; Mr. Keo S., who will be using the loan money to pay the water system fee; and Mrs. San C., who is requesting a loan to buy a motor for the family’s traveling needs.

Note: Mr. Uk S. and Mr. Keo S. were not available for photographing, so their wives are shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To pay for connecting a new water system

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena R. is a native of Jala-jala, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 34 years old and mother to three. She is married to Abelardo, a tricycle driver, 32 years old. She is a woman of courage and faith to overcome poverty.

She believes that the greatest gift in the world is opportunity; that is why in 2001, when she was given the opportunity to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, she really grabbed the chance. Since her first loan, she invested her loans in the resale of ready-to-wear clothes. These include school uniforms and blouses among many others.

Now on her 9th loan, she proposes a loan of 19,000 pesos as additional capital to pay for resale of school uniforms, 10 dozen blouses and polo shirts, 5 dozen skirts and 5 dozen black pants. And part of her loan will be invested in her secondary business: a variety store.She is positive that her business will grow since it catches the attention of the buying public.

With the proceeds she receives, she really dreams of saving for their future and for her children’s school needs, and she also dreams of building a small restaurant someday.

loans.use: resale of school uniforms, 10 dozen blouses and polo shirts, 5 dozen skirts and 5 dozen black pants

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A., age 38, is from the village of Tuburan. Rosita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita raises pigs for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Julissa Marciel

texts.es: Julissa Marciel M. F. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, su actividad es una pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace 7 años aproximadamente. Desde entonces este ha sido su negocio fuente de ingresos, de esta manera Julissa ha logrado salir adelante, con su esposo y su familia ya que han pasado situaciones muy difíciles como lo es su mayor preocupación enfermarse gravemente alega que prefiere morir luchando que jamás haberlo intentado. Esta vez Julissa ha acudido a Fundación León 2000 para que se le otorgue un financiamiento el cual le servirá en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes y aceite.
texts.en:
Julissa Marciel M. F. is 26 years-old and has one child. She works at a small grocery store, a business she began approximately seven years ago. Since then her business has been a source of income that has allowed her to pull through with her husband and family, who have already survived many very difficult situations. Her major worry is getting severely ill. She says she prefers to die fighting than to not even have tried. This time Julissa has gone to Fundación León 2000 so that they grant her financing which will allow her to buy basic grains, sweets, detergents and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nathalie Madinatou

texts.fr: A. Nathalie Madinatou est née vers 1975 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Nathalie Madinatou est mariée à DOUROSSIMI Wakili. Nathalie Madinatou est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Nathalie Madinatou vit à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Nathalie Madinatou arrive à satisfaire ses propres besoins. C’est des tissus que Nathalie Madinatou vend. Nathalie Madinatou a besoin de moyens financiers pour mieux développer son activité. C’est la raison pour laquelle  Nathalie Madinatou demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Nathalie Madinatou was born around 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to DOUROSSIMI Wakili and is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  Nathalie Madinatou lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Thanks to her business, she manages to support herself.  What she sells is cloth.  She needs funds to develop her business further. This is why she's asking for a loan, so as to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Twezebbe Namasaba Scovia Group

texts.en:
N. Scovia is thirty-eight years old and is representing her group loan. She is married, blessed with four children, all schooling, and is also looking after three dependents who are schooling, too. She has been operating a little restaurant for five years. She is lacking enough capital to boost her business.

She is requesting the loan to increase the daily food menu for her customers, to purchase a variety of drinks and fresh foods for cooking to accommodate the many customers who may stop over for meals. And due to increasing customer demand she is hoping for a big return. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: vary the daily menu for her customers

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: A. Félicité est née à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Félicité est mariée à OSSENI Aliou, un chauffeur. Félicité et Aliou ont six enfants à charge dont quatre sont les leurs. Tous les enfants en âge d’être scolarisé le sont. La famille vit au quartier Dowa à Porto-Novo. Félicité assurent avec Aliou les charges de la famille. C’est des tubercules d’igname que Félicité vend au marché Ouando de Porto-Novo. Félicité va jusqu’au Centre du Bénin pour s’approvisionner en tubercules d’igname, plus précisément à Glazoué, un des marchés internationaux des produits vivriers du Bénin. Félicité est une cliente de ALIDé qui a eu déjà deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Mais, toujours est-il que Félicité n’a pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour satisfaire toute la demande de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Félicité sollicite ce troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Félicité was born in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to OSSENI Aliou, a chauffeur. Félicité and Aliou have six children to support. Four of these children are their own. All the school-aged children are in school. The family lives in the Dowa district in Porto-Novo. Along with Aliou, she ensures that family expenses are covered. Yam tubers are what Félicité sells at the Ouando market of Porto-Novo. She goes to central Benin, more precisely to Glazoué, one of the international markets for staple foods, in order to stock up on yam tubers. Félicité is an ALIDé client who has already had two loans, which she has repaid. Though as ever, she lacks sufficient financial means for satisfying all the demands of her customers. For this reason, she’s requesting this third loan for bolstering her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a truckload of yam tubers

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy Q. is married and has four children. She has received a junior high school education.  Dorothy sells second hand cloths at the Elmina market, which she has been doing since 2001. Her husband is a seaman.  Dorothy uses her income to help her husband support the family in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Dorothy will use the loan to buy bails of second hand clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorothy plans to save to reinvest in the  business.

loans.use: Dorothy will use the loan to buy bails of second hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ángel Eliud

texts.es:
El señor Ángel Eliud R. ha tenido ya dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente y le han servido para construir en su vivienda. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder poner el vitropiso en el cuarto que construyo con los anteriores créditos. Ya que en este momento el no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de colocar el vitropiso. 
Don Ángel es empleado de un establecimiento que se dedican a comprar y vender partes de autos usados, en el departamento encargado, este es el ingreso de su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Claudia Ivonne Barcenas, esposa del señor Ángel Eliud  ya que el día de la visita el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ángel Eliud R. has already taken out two loans with Kiva partner FVP. Both loans were used to build his house, and he has paid them timely. Today he is requesting a loan to tile the floor of the room he built with the previous loans because currently he does not have the money to buy the materials and pay the person who will install the tiles. Ángel is employed as a manager in a used auto-parts business, and his income goes to support his family; a portion of it will now also go to pay back the loan. The person in the picture is Mrs. Claudia Ivonne Barcenas, Mr. Ángel Eliud's wife; the day we visited his home, he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and installing tiles for a room

loans.name: Lameck

texts.en:
Lameck M. N., 27, has run the "Classic Store" with his wife for the last six months. The store is located in a residential area in Magongo and they sell cereals, paraffin (kerosene), vegetable oil, sugar, detergents, rice, flour, etc. His challenges are that customers can't pay at the end of their pay cycles and further, over the holidays, many return to their villages and his business suffers.

Lameck is using his KES 80,000 loan to open another branch of the store in a busy new area.

Lameck also runs a barber shop where he has an employee. His long term business goal is to be a wholesaler and supply goods to small retail shops in Mombassa.

Lameck and his wife (pictured) have no children yet, but Lameck's goal is to have a stable life for his family with a house, a car, and good education for his own children. He is hardworking and feels confident that he can reach whatever goals he sets for himself.

loans.use: To open another branch of his store

loans.name: Shogofa Zahra Group

texts.en:
This is the Shogofa Zahra Group. This group has four members: Shogofa, Zahra, Soraya and Laila all live in Kabul, Afghanistan. Shogofa is the group leader. She wants a loan for her brother; he has a retail shop and wants to buy more food for his shop.

The second member of the Shogofa Zahra Group is Zahra; she wants a loan to buy clothes for her tailoring business.

The third member of the Shogofa Zahra Group is Soraya; she wants a loan for her embroidery business.

The fourth member of Shogofa Zahra Group is Laila; she is teaching an English language course and she wants to buy some necessary materials for her class.

They have requested a group loan of 40000 AFN to expand their businesses. They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food for a shop.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Alba es trabajadora del centro de insumos para la salud en el departamento de Limpieza.
Alba  va usar el crédito para Compra de  perlines, clavos y zinc.
Ella quiere cambiar una parte del techo por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.
Ella  es madre soltera de cuatro hijos dos de ellos están casado y dos están en la universidad.
Este es el segundo crédito que Perla ha tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 20 meses.
Alba dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Alba works in the housekeeping department of the health supply center. She will use the funds to buy zinc metal sheeting, edging and nails. She wants to replace part of her roof because it is poor condition. She is a single mother of four children, two of whom are married and two are university students. This is her second loan with CEPRODEL; she has collaborated with CEPRODEL for 20 months. Alba said that Ceprodel loans have helped her much with her home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting, edging, nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase lubricants for motors

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Selling clothes is the main part of 38-year-old Man A.’s daily routine. She operates her trade inside the local busy market and has been a clothes seller for years. She has a partner in her husband, who assists her in conducting the business.

Man A. currently runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good clothing she sells. In order to better satisfy the needs of her customers, she looks for a loan to increase the financial capital of her enterprise by buying more clothing.

Man A. has three kids, two of whom are taxi drivers.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio S. is from the village of Lingion, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 53 years old. Dionesio is married and has adult-aged children. To make a living, Dionesio owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services with the used of his motor vehicle. Dionesio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dionesio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesio is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dionesio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Mrs. Kunthea Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people make up this loan group.They live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kunthea H. is the group's leader, selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow vegetables to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Thuch Seng, sells recycled goods. Their field is ready to plant so Mrs. Kunthea H. decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed to grow. She has three children, two of whom attend the local public school, and the other is too small to go school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed to grow

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería además de tener este negocio también se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio en donde ofrece todo tipo de productos como es carne, pollo, gaseosa, detergente, pan, refrescos naturales. Ella tenía una fuente de ingresos necesaria para su hogar pues tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ser una persona independiente. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is 43 years old and she works at her grocery store. In addition to this business she also sells general merchandise. She has had this business for the last 10 years, she offers all types of products such as meats, poultry, sodas, detergents, bread and natural beverages. She needs this source of income because she is in charge of 4 children, also she likes to work and be independent. The loan is to increase her working capital in the purchase of raw materials. Her wishes are to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestro socio es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr FRANCISCO, Nuestro socio tiene 40 años  es casado y tiene 1 hijo, Nuestro socio se dedica al transporte, el tiene un vehículo que presta servicio de taxi en la ciudad del Cusco y algunas veces lleva a Urubamba pasajeros desde el Cusco. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos repuestos para su vehículo.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank “SACRO.” Our member is from the cruz pata community in the town of chinchero, province of Urubamba department of Cusco.

Our member is Mr. Francisco; he is 40 years old and married and has a son. Our member is in transportation, he has a vehicle and is a taxi driver in the city of Cusco and sometimes he takes passengers to Urubamba from Cusco. Our member needs a loan to buy some spare parts for his vehicle.

The member is grateful and values the support given to him by the organization and is determined to meet with his payments to the debt in the time set.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs the loan to buy some spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es:
Flora M. G. de 45 años, viven en la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente en la zona Santa Rosa de Lima, hace 8 años aproximadamente. Flora se dedica a la venta de tostados (habas secas y tostadas) en dos ferias, una de ellas se llama Remedios y otra  Ingavi y necesita el préstamo para la compra de insumos.
Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Unión Progreso, que a su vez, pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, se dedican a diversas actividades económicas como la venta de frutas, venta de comida, confección de prendas de vestir, venta de higiénicos, y trenzado de mantas.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima.
texts.en:
Flora M. G. is 45 years old. She has lived in the city of El Alto in the Santa Rosa de Lima region for approximately eight years. Flora sells “tostados” (dried and toasted beans) at two fairs. One is called Remedios, and the other is Ingavi. She needs the loan to buy supplies. The other members of the Unión Progreso Communal Bank, which belongs to the German Busch community center, have diverse economic activities like selling fruit, selling food, making clothes, selling hygienic products, or blanket braiding. They all need the loan to acquire merchandise, supplies, or raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Tsevel

texts.en:
Tsevel is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent). She has one daughter and two sons; two of the children are in secondary school and one is in kindergarten. The family has been living together in their current home for six years.

Tsevel operates a vegetable trading business at the local market with the help of her husband. She has been operating her business since 1990, and has steadily expanded it over the years. Tsevel used to purchase the vegetables she sells, but in 2009, she started growing the vegetables herself. She has a large 20-ton capacity warehouse in which she stores her products. Using her business profits, Tsevel purchased a plot of land for growing vegetables and a separate plot with a yard for her family. Tsevel is an open person and says, “Last year I planted vegetables on other people's land. Now I have my own land for my business. This will help my business and increase my earnings.” Tsevel is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan for this season's planting expenses.

loans.use: planting expenses

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married Lebanese man who is the father of four children. Since 1995, he has made a living working in construction. He is now very experienced in this field and very proud from the work he performs. He works as a freelancer, taking on housing and other projects such as building shops. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network of contacts and clients, because this is demanding work and there is lots of competition. But he built a good reputation among his clients and in his part of Lebanon. 

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to buy steel beams to use on various projects. This is his second loan, and he has successfully repaid his previous loan on time. This first loan allowed him to buy tools to use when working on his projects.

loans.use: To buy steel beams for a construction business

loans.name: Chantho's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantho C. is a 30-year-old married woman and is the village bank president, having been selected by the sixteen members located in Roka village in Takeo province.   Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chantho C. is a farmer who owns 3-hectare of land to cultivate rice on and she is also a glove weaver and pig breeder at home, who is able to earn a small income to help support her family. To support pig breeding and glove weaving, Mrs. Chantho C. decided to ask for a loan to bU. fabrics for glove weaving. With the rest of the loan she wants to bU. pig feed for pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Khem Doung, is a fisherman and also helps his wife. This couple has three children; one is attending the local school while the other two are too young to study or work. 

Mrs. Thoeung M. and Mrs. Mom S. are group guarantees present in the picture, while another one of the group is not clearly visible.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for glove weaving

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorea Temples. S. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of $1.50 US each per day. S. is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase rice grain to produce pig food to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buying rice grain

loans.name: Bunnet

texts.en: Mr. Bunnet M. (not in the photo; his wife is pictured instead) and his wife, Mrs. Sreytoch Thoeun, have been married since 1998 and have four children. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Bunnet has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. His wife weaves silk at home and takes care of their children. Bunnet is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.
