loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Aboukhasim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aboukhasim Diène  habite à  Ndeugagne, un des quartiers du village de Yoff. Il est âgé  de 46 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de 3 ans. 
Monsieur Diène  s’active dans le commerce  depuis  plusieurs années  à cause de son aspect lucratif. Depuis  1994 il gère une quincaillerie et s’adonne a la vente de  ciment, de fer, de béton, et de briques. Aussi il a une expérience  de plus de 30 ans dans la menuiserie et la maçonnerie. 
Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2004 et y a déjà  bénéficié  de 3 prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de ciment, de sable et de béton destinés a la vente.  En renforçant  son stock de commerce il souhaite augmenter ses revenus afin d’acquérir   un terrain  et mettre sa famille dans des conditions meilleures.
texts.en:
Mr. Aboukhasim Diène lives in Ndeugagne, one of the neighborhoods of the village of Yoff. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. Mr. Diène has been in business for many years because it is profitable. He has managed a hardware store since 1994 and sells cement, iron, concrete and bricks. He also has over 30 years experience in carpentry and masonry. He has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2004 and has already benefited from 3 previous loans. He is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy cement, sand and concrete to sell. By building his inventory he hopes to increase his income so that he can buy some land and improve conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Marikae Enole

texts.en:
Marikae Enole N. is 41 years old. She is married to N. Ntemel and the mother of six school-age children. Marikae has been a farmer for the last five years. Her farm is in a productive area and most of her customers are wholesalers from the city who come to buy her produce to sell in the city. 

She learned about KADET LTD through an awareness program by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan, fifty thousand KES, to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten-acre potato farm. Potatoes do very well in this area and have high yields due to fertile soil and adequate rainfall. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more farm land to meet the demand for farm produce. Her hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have her own farm machinery. Marikae is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre potatoe farm.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan.  Chan P., who is 41 year old and married, leads the group.  They all live in Khpob Veaeng village, Kandal province.  Each member will use their portion of the loan to support different businesses.
 
Chan is a Khmer noodle seller in the local market and her husband is a fisherman in the local village.  They are able to earn a small income to support their family.  In order to support her husband's business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnets and to fix their boat.  They have five children.

loans.use: Buy fishnets and to fix boat.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion G., 37, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo G., a tricycle driver, and mother to three young hard working teenagers. By the grace of God, Salvacion has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Salvacion operates a variety store where she also sells mineral water. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP18, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Salvacion dreams to be able to renovate her house soon with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Abiud

texts.en:
Abiud N. is 34 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school. He has a dairy farm in Murang'a town, central Kenya where he has been farming for ten years.

Abiud has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 20,000 KES for breeding rabbits. This loan will help increase the household income for his family through the sale of rabbits. His biggest challenges have been drought and lack of enough animal feed. He hopes that in five years' time, he will have reached the level of national rabbit breeder.

He comments that Juhudi is giving hope to the poor through financial services that they cannot access through the banks.

loans.use: For breeding rabbits to sell

loans.name: Choeu

texts.en: Mrs. Choeu C. is a 39-year-old married woman who operates a small business by selling and buying used products from her home. She can make her profit every day to support her family. Mrs. Choeu C.’s husband also works with her in the same business. Mrs. Choeu C. and her husband are blessed with four children who are no longer in school, and who are sewing clothes in a garment factory. In order to add income and make her trade more successful, Mrs. Choeu C. would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorbike to travel to buy used goods.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike to travel to buy used goods

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom M. is 52 and married with six children. She and her family live in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temple. Mom and her husband are farmers, earning a daily income of about 1 USD. Two of her children are employed by factories and each earns a daily income of 3 USD that goes to help cover family expenses. Every month, Mom has to spend 83 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water, and 50 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Mom is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase blacksmith supplies to improve one of her children’s businesses. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. In the future, Mom would like to use any profit to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy blacksmith supplies

loans.name: Sommie Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sommie Roxana; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lencería (ropa interior para mujeres y varones), ella distribuye a las diferentes tiendas donde vende ropas interiores, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender la ropa interior. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The member belongs to the community bank "El Amanecer".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.  Her name is Sommie Roxana, and she is 47 years old, single, and has one son.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling lingerie (underwear for women and men).  She distributes to different stores where they sell underwear.  Through this work, she is able to get her son ahead.  She wants to have a shop in order to sell underwear.  She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise, and is grateful for those who form part of this dream through this means and she promises to complete the payments in the established timeline.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gustavo de 37 años, con 2 hijos menores en edad escolar, vive en casa propia en el barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Tobati.
Cuenta con un taller propio de chapería y pinturas, su responsabilidad y buen trabajo, le permitió contar con una clientela formada en la zona, lo que hace que no le falte trabajo.
Solicita un crédito a la Fundación y Kiva, para realizar mejoras en su local de trabajo, (terminar un sanitario), poniendo comodidad para su clientela y colaboradores.
texts.en: Gustavo, 37, has 2 school-aged children and lives in his own home in the San Roque neighborhood of the city of Tobati.  He has an auto body shop.  Due to his responsibility and good work he has acquired a regular customer base in the neighborhood so that he never lacks work.  He requests a loan from the Fundación and Kiva to make improvements in his workshop, (to finish a bathroom), for the comfort of his customers and co-workers.

loans.use: to make improvements to his auto body shop

loans.name: Fanny Viviana

texts.es:
La Señora Fanny F. es socia del banco comunal Atenas y vive por el sector de Ucubamba, en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad realizando varias actividades.

La Señora Fanny tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad quienes  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en su taller de aluminio y vidrio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegro.

Doña Fanny ayuda  en el taller de su esposo, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y cuando tienen obras por entregar trabajan de domingo a domingo sin horario.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 4 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más aluminio, vidrio y hierro para su taller. Su meta es  tener su taller propio.
texts.en: Mrs. Fanny F. is a member of the Atenas community bank and lives in the Ucubamba sector, where the people work in agriculture and much of the population work various jobs in the city. Fanny is 26, married and has 2 children ages 9 and 5 who are enrolled in a school in the city. Her husband works in an aluminium and class factory. They do not have their own home because they live in her father-in-law's home. Fanny helps out in her husband's workshop. She has been doing this for 5 years, and when they have work for a deadline, she works all week long with no schedule. She has been a member of the community bank for 4 years and she will invest her loan in the purchase of more aluminium, class and iron for the workshop. Her goal is to have her own workshop.

loans.use: to purchase aluminium, class and iron.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna Isabel H., trabaja como Metodóloga en el área de Atención al Participante en el CECNA, desde hace 2 años.

Es soltera con 1 personas a su cargo en edad escolar, ella es licenciada en Trabajo Social.

Este es su segundo crédito que tiene en CEPRODEL, hasta la fecha ha demostrado una buena moral de pago, el plan de inversión que tiene previsto con este crédito es la reparación del techo de su vivienda y cubrir gastos médicos de su hija.
texts.en:
Ms. Reyna Isabel H. has worked for two years as a Participant Service Methodologist for CECNA [The Nicaraguan-German Center for Professional Training].

She is single and has one school-age daughter under her care.  She is a licensed social worker.

This is the second loan that she has received through CEPRODEL and up to this point, she has shown herself to be good about her repayments.  She plans to invest this loan in repairs for the roof of her house, as well as to cover medical expenses for her daughter.

loans.use: to repair the roof on her home and to cover medical expenses for her daughter

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn S. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Jocelyn is married and has an infant. To make a living, Jocelyn raises pigs for breeding. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 27 años de edad, su familia está conformada por su esposo José Israel  y sus cuatro hijos: Kevin de 9 años, Merari de 6 años, Josué Ariel de 4 años y José de 1 año de edad, todos son dependientes. Verónica y su esposo se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 2 años, esta idea nace por la necesidad de trabajar y tener dinero para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras, las cuales adquiere en el mercado de San Miguel, con los fondos del préstamo quiere surtir y mejorar el negocio, los únicos riesgos es los cambios de precio que existen a diario en la mercadería.
Las aspiraciones de ella es trabajar diariamente por mejorar la atención y el servicio a los clientes, también velar por su hogar y las necesidades, apoyando a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Verónica lives in Corinto, Morazán department.  She is 27 years old and her family is made up of her husband, José Israel, and their four dependent children: Kevin, 9, Merari, 6, Josué Daniel, 4 and José, 1. Verónica and her husband have been selling fruit and vegetables for the last two years.  This idea arose out of the need to work and have income to cover their children’s expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables that she gets in San Miguel’s market.  She wants to use the funds from the loan to stock and improve the business.  The only risks are the daily price fluctuations of the merchandise.

Her dream is to work daily to improve customer service and to watch over her home and needs supporting her children’s schooling.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a food production sales business, a sari-sari (general) store and a charcoal sales business. Her husband Nasir, who is 49 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 13 and 26 years old. Sitti Hawa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sitti Hawa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,500 to buy stocks for her store and food products so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of her business. Sitti Hawa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store and for her food production

loans.name: Dewile

texts.en: Dewile is a thirty-six year old hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He trades in business and in the four years he has been able to pay school fees for six of his children with the help of his wife, who is a farmer. He has the challenge of seasonal changes that affect coffee prices and his dream is to set up a store. Dewile intends to use the loan to buy coffee.

loans.use: to buy coffee.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old and married, with 5 children, whose ages range from 18 to 30 years old. 

Rosita is a farmer who has been growing rice for 10 years. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. Rosita also sells fresh and dried fish. She says she buys directly from fishermen and goes around the neighborhood to sell fish. She also dries fish to sell as well.

Rosita has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and eight siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a taxi driver since 2006. In addition, he works as a private driver transporting students and teachers from their houses to the school and vice versa. This young man recently had an accident which led to a paralysis in his hand. So, he had to attend expensive physiotherapy sessions in order to get the crucial treatment for him to recover. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the necessary maintenance on his car and purchase a new engine. This will allow him to transport the customers suitably without facing any vehicle damages. He is in real need of earning a good income to handle his health expenses and help his family with the household budget.

loans.use: to perform the necessary maintenance on his car and purchase a new engine.

loans.name: Favia Francisca

texts.es:
Favia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene tres  hijos.  La señora estudió educación superior técnico. 
Su primer préstamo solicitado del Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue por la suma D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. buffet (comidas).  Paralelamente brinda servicio D. taxi (transporte).
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2,300.00 nuevos soles comprará juegos D. vajillas y otros insumos para su negocio venta D. buffet.  Favia trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja en el magisterio y sus hijos trabajan en servicio D. taxi.
Su sueño es ser una gran empresaria en el rubro D. buffets.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la ganancia del ahorro y la amistad con las socias.
texts.en:
Favia is a member of the “Las Intocables” [The Untouchables] community bank, located in the district of Puno, province and departament of Puno. She is 53 years old, married and has three children. She has an education from a technical high school. She took out her first loan from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in selling artisanal crafts. 

At present, she sells catering food. She also runs a taxi service (transportation). With this new loan S/ 2,300.00 nuevos soles, she will buy sets of dishes and other materials for her catering business. Favia works alone and her husband works as a teacher. Her children also work in the taxi service.  

Her dream is to be a great businesswoman in the catering business. What she likes about the community bank is the ease in taking out loans, the interest on savings, and the friendship among the members.

loans.use: to buy sets of dishes and materials.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe A. is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fe has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty sells alcohol. She is 28 years old and married, with two children. One of them goes to school.

Betty borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica: ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde hace mucho tiempo, ella nos cuenta que tambien como una segunda actividad se dedica a la venta de rezes ya que en la comunidad donde ella vive no hay tienda serca entonces su negocio ha prosperado ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles ya esta convencida de que nececita mas capital para trabajar y asi poder aumentar sus ganacias.
texts.en:
Angelica has sold foodstuffs for quite some time.  She also tells us that as a second activity she sells cattle because in the community where she lives there is no store nearby so her business has prospered.

She is asking for the loan to buy foodstuffs because she’s convinced that she needs more capital to work and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Teresa y la Sra. Edelida, quienes se había acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invito a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 17 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
La Sra. Blanca se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, tales como hamburguesas, empanadas, tortillas y demás y es ella misma se encarga de comercializar sus propios productos. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder preparar esos alimentos que va a vender. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y responsable.
Solicita el credito para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los alimentos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Teresa and Edelida who had come to Fundación Paraguaya's office to find out more about the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) program.  They invited their friends and people from their neighborhood to form a group in order to get ahead in life and improve their living standards.  There are 17 hard-working and unassuming women in this group who must earn a living every day.

Blanca's business is selling all kinds of food such as burgers, empanadas, tortillas, etc.  She is in charge of selling her own products.  Every day she gets up very early in order to prepare the food which she later sells.  She describes herself as a very hard-working and responsible person.

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients that she needs to make her food.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients that she needs to make the food that she produces (meat, eggs, spices, etc.)

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child currently in school. Hadijah has had a wholesale shoe business for two years and has a second business selling tap water.  

To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase shoes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hadijah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, Hadijah hopes to own a small retail shop that sells sugar. Hadijah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.en:
Justiniano is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Justiniano has a pigpen that sells grown pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.
Justiniano has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Justiniano hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita has been blessed with four children. Three of them are married while the youngest is still studying.

Rosita started her junk shop business with small capital. She buys recycled materials such as empty cans, bottles, scrap metals, galvanized iron, plastic bottles and wares in their community and other nearby villages to increase her profit. She has been running this business for almost four years and she earns about P2500 monthly. She uses her net income for school fees and for their daily needs such as rice and  other ingredients for making meals.

Rosita is applying for a loan amounting to P15,000 to buy recycled materials such as empty bottles, cans, scrap metals, galvanized iron and wares for her junk shop business. She is hoping that she can maintain the business she manages in order to survive and prepare for the future needs of her children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials such as empty bottles, cans, scrap metals, galvanized iron and wares for her junk shop business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. 

Elizabeth requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to order more charcoal to sell with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase or order for more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru: Elnur 20 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elnur jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On uje 2 qoda kak virashivayet pomidori. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenku i balki dlya togo chtobi sdelat parnik dlya pomidora. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje imel svoy parnik.
texts.en: Elnur is 20 years old.  He is single and does not have children.  Elnur lives in the Baku region together with his family.  He has been growing tomatoes for two years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy plastic and beams in order to build a greenhouse for tomatoes.  He learned this business from his father, who also had his own greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy plastic and beams in order to build a greenhouse for tomatoes

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a focused businessman who is 55 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. For over 10 years, he has been selling sand to earn a living. He has employed three people to help him to manage the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand.

loans.use: To buy sand to sell

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Jesús socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad,está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera en cuartones y lo realiza en su misma casa porque vive en la zona industrial, ahí mismo almacena toda su madera.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 15 tablones de madera aserrada.

Para trabajar con madera se necesita un buen capital, pero como no cuenta con más capital, está comprando  poco a poco y con las ventas sigue invirtiendo.
Su esposo es maestro afilador y trabaja en un aserradero, ella es la que se queda en su casa para atender su negocio y también a sus hijos, gracias por lo que a logrado con su trabajo y quiere seguir trabajando por mucho más tiempo con Manuela Ramos para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
En la foto se muestra con uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus is a member of the “Mujeres Productivas” (Productive Women) communal bank of Manantay district, Ucayali depatment. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children.

She buys and sells dressed timber and she is able to do so in her own house because she lives in the industrial zone where she stores all her lumber.

With her new loan of 1,000 new sols she will buy 15 sawed beams.

To work with lumber, one needs a good amount of capital but since she can't count on more capital, she is buying little by little, and with her sales she continues to invest.

Jesus' husband is a master saw blade sharpener who works in a saw mill. Jesus is the one who remains at home to attend to business and also, the children. For this reason, she has advanced her business and wants to continue working much longer with Manuela Ramos [a micro-finance institution], in order to improve her life and that of her family.

In the photo, she appears with one of her children.

loans.use: to buy lumber to sell.

loans.name: 06.02.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 40 years old and she is married with two children.  She lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.  Ngân is the leader of a 6-member group, called the 01 Đông Vệ Solidarity Group. She has a manufacturing business making incense and has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  The main business hardship she faces is a lack of capital.

In 2010, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.   She has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a new loan to purchase materials to make votive objects to sell.  Ngân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects for sale.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, who is 31 years old, is a farmer. By feeding pigs, she earns $2 per day. Her husband buys and sells cows, earning $5 per day. The couple has two children, aged three years old and two months old. Every month, they have to spend $42 on food and $15 on transportation.

Thy would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows for resale. The loan will help the family decrease their transportation expenses and enable her husband to run his business well. Thy wants to build a cow stable that is bigger and nicer to keep the cows that her husband has bought for resale.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Borrower lives in Cambodia

loans.use: Home renovations

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 28 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Vive con su pareja, con quien tiene una hija de dos años en su casa propia, en donde a diario se esfuerzan mucho para poder tener mejores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Angélica consiste en la venta de comida, así como vender pollo en un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad. Durante las noches expende comida en la vereda de su casa, entre los diferentes platos que ofrece están el salchipollo, pollo broaster, hamburguesas y más. Lleva haciendo estos dos trabajo ya por tres años y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que esta en constante movimiento durante todo el día, esto le permite ver a su menor hija quien necesita mucho de ella. Le esta yendo bien y espera seguir por ese camino, ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos y así ser cumplida en su compromisos de pago. Aemás ella tiene en mente ampliar su negocio y tener mas adelante un restaurante. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta con el aporte que le darán para aumentar su capital de trabajo y así consolidar su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete en seguir siendo puntual con sus cuotas como en el anterior crédito. Con el monto solicitado, comprará pollitos para iniciar su crianza, además de algunos ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la preparación de los deliciosos platos de comida que vende.
texts.en: Angélica is 28 years old. She is a good, friendly and responsible woman. She lives with her spouse, with whom she has a two year old daughter. They live in their own house, where every day they work hard to make better income and improve their quality of life. Angélica's job is selling food, as well as chicken in a sales stall she has in the city market. At night, she sells food from the sidewalk in front of her house. Among the different dishes she offers are sausage and chicken, roasted chicken, hamburgers and more. She has been doing these two jobs for three years and she does them alone. What she likes about her job is that she is in constant movement all day, this allows her to see her daughter, who really needs her. It is going well for her and she hopes to keep going down this road, since it allows her to have good income and make all of her payments on time. In addition, she plans on expanding her business and have a restaurant in the future. This will be her second loan with MFP and she is very happy with what she is being given to increase her working capital and consolidate her business. On the other hand, she is committed to keep making her payments on time as with the previous loan. With the loan she has asked for, she will buy chicks to begin raising, as well as other ingredients and materials to keep making the delicious dishes she sells.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise, as well as ingredients and materials to make more food.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina operates a boutique from home. She sells beautiful clothes to her clients. Her clients include women of her community and shopkeepers at a nearby market.  She loves her profession and makes good sales and profits every month. 

Her husband runs a food selling business in the market. The taste of his food is very good and he has a good number of loyal clients who come to his shop everyday to eat. 

Zarina is the mother of six sons; her eldest works with his father and two are students.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to expand her boutique business.  With the loan, she will buy beads, threads and clothes needed to prepare beautiful and attractive looking clothes for selling.

She has operated her business for many years and is very confident about her success.

loans.use: to buy beads, threads and clothes needed to prepare beautiful and attractive looking clothes for selling.

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en:
Doeurn, age 44, and her husband, Chom, age 47, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have one son and 6 daughters; 2 are garment workers, 2 attend school and the other 3 are still young.  

Doeurn and her husband are farmers. They grow tomatoes and corn on their farmland in the village where they live. Doeurn is asking for her first loan of 1,000 USD to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. 

Photo: Doeurn is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 28 years old and is married with an 8-year-old child. For the past eight years, he has worked as a farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. Nestor primarily grows rice crops to sell and he earns about 6,000 PHP per month from farming. Nestor also owns a sari-sari (variety) store business that his wife manages. They sell various items like shampoo, soap, coffee, vinegar, and sugar.

Nestor is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and more items, such as canned goods, to sell at his store. In the future, he hopes to earn more and be able to make a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and items to sell at his store

loans.name: Three Stars Group

texts.en: Stella, center, is a 39 year widow from Chiredzi. She has 2 children aged 21 and 17 years with the younger one still going to school. Stella is in the business of selling motor oils in Chiredzi town. She has been in the business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of $400.00 for additional supplies of lubricants to sell. To help her in her operations, Stella has 2 workers, one doing the administration work and the other one doing sales and marketing of her products. Stella says the challenge she faces in the business is the availability of lubricants at a prices where she can make a profit. She is planning to open a shop where she can sell all spare motor parts rather than just lubricants. With the extra income generated from the loan, Stella will be able to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional motor oil to sell
